commit_message:
Accept role list from either X-Roles or X-Role

Accept the list of roles from either the newer X-Roles header or the
deprecated X-Role header.

This is useful for interoperability with a software proxy in front
of Nova API that performs token authentication and might use the
older header.

Change-Id: I47e33233edf596dd14d07b6be16b030fd6bc352d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-22 16:13:37.000000000', 'message': "Remove partial image data when filesystem is full

When an image is uploaded that fills up the local filesystem, attempt
to delete the created file. This only applies to the 'filesystem'
store driver.

Fixes bug 1019421

Change-Id: Ie12d736f3efb29b0862fef2899a1d2c142def38e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove partial image data when filesystem is full

When an image is uploaded that fills up the local filesystem, attempt
to delete the created file. This only applies to the 'filesystem'
store driver.

Fixes bug 1019421

Change-Id: Ie12d736f3efb29b0862fef2899a1d2c142def38e

subject: Add os:distro, os:version, os:architecture schemas
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-08-22 15:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Important (possibly controversial) thing to note here: the os:distro is documented here as the distribution common name, not the domain name suggested in the original proposal. This means using 'ubuntu' instead of 'org.ubuntu' and 'fedora' instead of 'org.fedoraproject'."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-22 15:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-22 15:21:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add os:distro, os:version, os:architecture schemas

The v2 API should ship with schema bits for common image
properties such as os:distro, os:version and os:architecture.

Fixes bug 1039815

Change-Id: I5b7ff6174891664b9c5f9792c216b9dd25e9d348
'}]
commit_message:
Add os:distro, os:version, os:architecture schemas

The v2 API should ship with schema bits for common image
properties such as os:distro, os:version and os:architecture.

Fixes bug 1039815

Change-Id: I5b7ff6174891664b9c5f9792c216b9dd25e9d348

'}, {'created': '2012-08-16 13:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes issue with non string header values in glance client

Fixes bug 1032798

By using Glance client on Windows the following exception is raised:

TypeError: sequence item 0: expected string, long found

Change-Id: Ib4528702b11aabdf939c6358f92ad7ff9c3ff20d
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes issue with non string header values in glance client

Fixes bug 1032798

By using Glance client on Windows the following exception is raised:

TypeError: sequence item 0: expected string, long found

Details on how to reproduce the error are available in the bug description

Change-Id: Ib4528702b11aabdf939c6358f92ad7ff9c3ff20d

messages:

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-merge/73/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-python27/71/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:33:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Code LGTM.

It's not that important, but I am curious: why do you have --null set args.yes_null instead of args.null?"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 21:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Consistency with the existing arg, "--all" which sets "yes_all".'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 21:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Arguably, I could have changed "--all" to set "all" and "--null" to set "null".  But I didn't.  ;)'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Patch look good but I was a bit confused by the naming --null, what about something like --check or --no-download ?'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-28 18:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I like --no-download.  The "null" bit was historical and just because I initially thought of the patch as "opening /dev/null" instead of some actual write target.  But that's an unintuitive command-line argument name.

I'll change it to --no-download.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-28 18:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Going to change --null to --no-download.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-28 20:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-28 20:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add ability to download without writing to disk.

This patch adds a "--no-download" option to the "download" command.
When given, all writing to disk is bypassed, while still actually
downloading the data and validating etags.

This can be handy when you're using the swift command-line client to
test out a swift cluster and don't want client-side disk writing to be a
bottle-neck (but you still want to know about any etag validation
failures).

Change-Id: I0a511f473a64820161d1eb529b995900742794f2

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-06-28 13:30:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/346/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-pep8/119/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python26/225/testReport : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-python27/226/testReport : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-06-28 13:39:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Aside from whatever Jenkins found, note that invalidating installations' entire memcache pools upon upgrade seems like Really Bad Idea (tm). I'm not sure how you'd like to handle the upgrade process; perhaps a configuration setting of "allow_crappy_memcache_pickles" and a prominent note in the release notes when they come out?'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-06-28 18:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

For a large Swift installation, one does not simply shut down the cluster to upgrade it; rather, one node at a time is upgraded so that the service stays available. In that scenario, this change would have the old and the new Swift nodes poisoning one another via memcached; the old nodes would choke on JSON-encoded data put there by the new nodes, while the new nodes would choke on pickle-encoded data put there by the old nodes.

One possible solution to this is to put some versioning on the stuff in memcached, for example prefixing a "v1:" to the keys used in swift.common.MemcacheRing.get/set. That would enable a gradual upgrade wherein the new and old code store different things under different keys in memcached, and thus do not poison each other. It would also allow for future changes to the data format just by changing the prefix.

Note: Fixing the poisoning is necessary, but I am not certain if it is sufficient. I don't know what problems might arise if different servers have different ideas of what's in the cache, nor do I have a good idea of the performance implications (as gholt alluded to in his comment). However, I do think that moving to a serialization format that doesn't allow arbitrary code execution is an excellent idea, so please don't interpret my comments as implying that we should stick with pickle; we shouldn't.'}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-06-29 08:53:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was updating the code to be able to unpickle data, but good point about poisoning if some nodes keep running the old code for a bit.

I guess there are two ways to approach this (not sure if this should be a blueprint or not, btw):

 - either we try to find a generic solution that will work for future changes in how we use memcache too (that would imply versioning, although I'd do that in the flags -- but prefixing the key will be needed because of the existing code)

 - or we consider a more simple approach that won't really scale in case there are more similar changes: add a config option to say we want to use pickle for writing in memcache (fix poisoning issue while all nodes get upgraded); after a few versions, remove that option but still allow unpickling with an option (fix invalidating everything, as pointed out by gholt); after a few versions, remove that other option and live in a 100% JSON world.

The second option is much simpler. It's obviously hard to predict the future, but the first option might well just be over-engineered for something where we might not have any similar issues before a long time.

I'm happy to go in either direction :-)"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-06-30 03:51:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd vote for:

Now:

    New config option:

    # Sets how memcache values are serialized and deserialized:
    # 0 = older, insecure pickle serialization
    # 1 = json serialization but pickles can still be read (still insecure)
    # 2 = json serialization only (secure and the default)
    # To avoid an instant full cache flush, existing installations should
    # upgrade with 0, then set 1 and reload, then after some time (24 hours)
    # set 2 and reload.
    memcache_value_serialization = 2

Future:

    Remove the ability to use values 0 and 1."}, {'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-07-02 13:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-02 13:22:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

[{'created': '2012-06-28 13:28:37.000000000', 'message': "Do not use pickle for serialization in memcache, but JSON

We don't want to use pickle as it can execute arbitrary code.

JSON is safer. However, note that it supports serialization for only
some specific subset of object types; this should be enough for what we
need, though.

We ignore memcached values that are flagged as serialized with pickle,
to avoid any potential issues with a memcached server still having
cached values serialized with old code.

By default, json.load() will convert strings to unicode objects. We
likely prefer to have str objects, so a specific JSON decoder is used to
automatically convert to str.

Part of bug 1006414.

Change-Id: Id7d6d547b103b4f23ebf5be98b88f09ec6027ce4

though.

To avoid issues on upgrades (unability to read pickled values, and cache
poisoning for old servers not understanding JSON), we add a
memcache_serialization_support configuration option, with the following
values:

 0 = older, insecure pickle serialization
 1 = json serialization but pickles can still be read (still insecure)
 2 = json serialization only (secure and the default)

To avoid an instant full cache flush, existing installations should
upgrade with 0, then set to 1 and reload, then after some time (24

commit_message:
Do not use pickle for serialization in memcache, but JSON

We don't want to use pickle as it can execute arbitrary code. JSON is
safer. However, note that it supports serialization for only some
specific subset of object types; this should be enough for what we need,
though.

To avoid issues on upgrades (unability to read pickled values, and cache
poisoning for old servers not understanding JSON), we add a
memcache_serialization_support configuration option, with the following
values:

 0 = older, insecure pickle serialization
 1 = json serialization but pickles can still be read (still insecure)
 2 = json serialization only (secure and the default)

To avoid an instant full cache flush, existing installations should
upgrade with 0, then set to 1 and reload, then after some time (24
hours) set to 2 and reload. Support for 0 and 1 will be removed in
future versions.

Part of bug 1006414.

Change-Id: Id7d6d547b103b4f23ebf5be98b88f09ec6027ce4

commit_message:
Live migration does not use libvirt's live migration.

What OpenStack calls live migration does not use libvirt's live
migration functionality. Document that this is the case and how
to enable libvirt live migration

Also, some minor reorg and tightening of some text in the live
migration section.

Changes the name from "Live Migration" to "Migration"

Mentions that Xen also supports (live) migration, points to wikki

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/11172

Change-Id: Ieb5bc3079ec7523512b58ef4bc5de4c5a3ce4419

commit_message:
fallocate call error handling

fallocate() failures properly return HTTPInsufficientStorage from
object-server before reading from wsgi.input, allowing the proxy
server to error_limit that node.

Change-Id: Idfc293bbab2cff1e508edf58045108ca1ef5cec1

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-13 08:23:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to optionally launch the heat service.

This draft review is to give the heat developers something to comment on,
and to give the devstack developers a preview of heat support.

This allows the heat service to be started as a devstack service.

Heat is disabled by default, and can be enabled with this in your localrc:
ENABLED_SERVICES+=,heat,h-api,h-eng,h-meta

There is now a repo of heat-enabled images here:
https://github.com/heat-api/prebuilt-jeos-images/downloads

These can be added to the IMAGE_URLS in your localrc.

After devstack is launched, a template can be invoked with:
nova keypair-add --pub_key $HOME/.ssh/id_rsa.pub heat_key
heat -d create wordpress \
--template-file=../heat/templates/WordPress_Single_Instance.template \
--parameters="InstanceType=m1.tiny;DBUsername=wpuser;DBPassword=wppassword;\
KeyName=heat_key;LinuxDistribution=F16"

Change-Id: I07591295eb2b9eb7868b1577dd3c24b19812a689

commit_message:
Add support to optionally launch the heat service.

This allows the heat service to be started as a devstack service.

Heat is disabled by default, and can be enabled with this in your localrc:
ENABLED_SERVICES+=,heat

There is now a repo of heat-enabled images here:
https://github.com/heat-api/prebuilt-jeos-images/downloads

These can be added to the IMAGE_URLS in your localrc.

After devstack is launched, a template can be invoked with:
nova keypair-add --pub_key $HOME/.ssh/id_rsa.pub heat_key
heat -d create wordpress \
--template-file=../heat/templates/WordPress_Single_Instance.template \
--parameters="InstanceType=m1.tiny;DBUsername=wpuser;DBPassword=wppassword;\
KeyName=heat_key;LinuxDistribution=F16"

Change-Id: I07591295eb2b9eb7868b1577dd3c24b19812a689

commit_message:
Add quantum files for apts + rpms

bug 1042446

Lists are based off of Nova packages and quantum tools/pip-requires

This is needed urgently to get quantum gate up and running, which is
failing because python-netaddr was not installed by the devstack gate.

Change-Id: I8cdac75e577468dd826ac71b70112033d7bd9468

commit_message:
Fix KeyError when test_servers_get fails.

Updates the integrated.test_api_samples.ServersSampleAllExtensionXmlTest
test_servers_get function so that it doesn't try to list the line number
when the test fails.

Fixes a KeyError: '\'i\' exceptions.

Partial fix for LP Bug #1042709.

Change-Id: I666d18c1d4585cebce4534b1f16cd327850e8cdc

commit_message:
Record skipped tests.

Record skipped tests. Ensure that this plugin runs before the skip test
plugin as that plugin removes the SkipTest exceptions from the pipeline
and the data isn't available unless you run before the skip plugin.

Change-Id: I0f2b1be51981ca0191f36bdd577d98cd0e99e88e

commit_message:
Port existing code to utils.ensure_tree

Now that we have ensure_tree in utils, port most users of
os.makedirs() to use it.

Change-Id: I3256cbb76bd889f99f1e6f3367bd620645f828a1

'}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-08-17 10:56:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hey David, thanks for that, this feature does not seem to be tested any chance to add a test for that?"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-17 13:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

All I did was exactly duplicate the plumbing for os_service_ type. I guess you could say that one doesn't have a test either. The problem is that both of these arguments are simply passed through to the keystone client which is 100% faked out.
I don't see how this could be further tested in the unit-test framework without introducing a more real keystone but would love to hear if you have another way.  Of course I tested this against a real swift/keystone cluster."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-20 14:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 14:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-merge/76/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-docs/26/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-pep8/75/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-python26/74/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-python-swiftclient-python27/74/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-21 17:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Any chance of getting this in soon? I added a new test. This fix is needed in order to fix the glance bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1036193'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-08-21 18:39:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

It all looks reasonable to me, but I don't have a Keystone installation to test with at the moment, so I haven't tried it out."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Just one consmetics. It would be nice as well to have the commit message reworked to standard git commit message, having Fixes bug ##### not in title but in the body of the commit (after an empt line).'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-28 12:58:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Unfortunately there was a recent change about changing '_' to '_' that totally conflicts with this. I tried to resolve it but ended up with a committed merge due to not being a git/gerrit wizard. What it the procedure for resolving this kind of conflict?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2012-08-28 13:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

you just git fetch origin and git rebase origin/master which would get you in conflict mode. you can use git st to see which file conflicts and fix them with your editor when all of them are fixed make sure you do a git add of the resolved files (or use  git mergetool to short all of that). git review should pass after..'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-28 14:25:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Still doesn't work for me. Submitting new patch."}]

commit_message:
nova reset-state API call not in essex

The API call that corresponds to nova reset-state is implemented
in Folsom. This removes references to it in the Essex troubleshooting
docs.

Change-Id: I6701ee30c28f9a73c69ba0a80aba070e8f2e2b39

commit_message:
Log the instance causing the error when a pollster fails

If a pollster fails, such as when libvirt cannot find an
instance that nova thinks still exists, report the instance
that caused the error.

Change-Id: I7a42ed12954265c29b476f99d9f18db50d3b553d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Remove test skipping logic.

We have a patch going into MIM to support the type of
query that made us need a real MongoDB so we can remove
these skips.

Change-Id: Ieb481492d654031edddfc7506e404fa0e0f2c2f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Remove dependency on nova test modules

Replace all nova test module calls with stubs or mocks to avoid
issues caused by changes in the nova test framework or nova itself.

Change-Id: I07248b64cc5c30c90c5e68df09ae8dfc2875c279
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Implement Blueprint iSCSI-CHAP.

Add new parameter to the volume creation, all the drivers and implement CHAP for
iSCSI driver. The target is limited to tgtadm.
Add the API to enable and disable the authentication of a volume.
Add the authentication into the connection initialization for the volume.
Change-Id: Ib73dd1db2c54ebdb905c98513f4d80a64bd8161f

subject: Add compute API extension: admin-actions
messages:
[{'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-22 23:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 02:39:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

One of these days, I've got to learn WADL..."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-25 20:46:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Daisy - help me understand the .json samples. The WADL says that tenant_id and server_id are request parameters but all the .json examples just have null values - is that correct? 
Thanks,
Anne"}, {'account_id': 3108, 'date': '2012-08-27 03:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The "tenant_id" and "server_id" are the required parameters of the request URL. The URL should like "v2/<tenant_id>/servers/<server_id>/action". The JSON is very simple, just including the name of the action.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-27 14:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Okay, thanks for the explanation, I had to think about that one. :) Sorry for the delay, appreciate the patch!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-27 14:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-27 14:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/708/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-27 21:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry to revisit this, but taking a closer look, I believe the requests have to be prefixed with os- and resetState is missing. Can you take a look? Or should I just log a doc bug?'}, {'account_id': 3108, 'date': '2012-08-28 09:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Besides the actions in this patch, admin-actions still has the following methods: createBackup, os-migrateLive, and os-resetState. Only os-migrateLive and os-resetState have "os_" as prefix. You can take look at the source code of "admin-actions" in Nova. I have submitted a new bug Bug #1042652 for this.'}]

commit_message:
Add three parameters chap_username, chap_password and chap_type into the cinder
client for the volume creation. Add the functions at the client side to enable and disable the authentication
for a volume.

Blueprint iSCSI-CHAP.

Change-Id: I29105b4faaa90bd374c2c0873139e35994aafe99

Sorry I have abandoned previous commit by mistake. ( I made mistake twice )
I wanna reply review comment here.

> Salvatore

_ENGINE is a global variable, and this patch seem to confirm that for each plugin we overwrite it. Does this mean that all loaded plugins will endup using the same engine (ie: the one of the last plugin loaded)?

Yes. Each plugin will use same engine since they use same db objects.
This is kind of hacky but it is needed to run multiple plugin in one database.
I wanna discuss this problem in G summit.

> Mark

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Maybe something worth considering is to call db.configure_db(options) prior to loading the plugins. This will set the db_ENGINE.
This is not an ideal solution...'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Hi,
As agreed this is patchy and we need to address this properly in G.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The configure_db sets the _ENGINE flag. It is due to the fact that each plugin is calling this you have to reset it which is very patchy.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
This is odd. The code is as follows:

def configure_db(options):
    """
    Establish the database, create an engine if needed, and
    register the models.

    :param options: Mapping of configuration options
    """
    global _ENGINE
    if not _ENGINE:
        connection_dict = sql.engine.url.make_url(options['sql_connection'])
        engine_args = {
            'pool_recycle': 3600,
            'echo': False,
            'convert_unicode': True,
        }


So my understanding is that if you call this prior to calling the self._load_plugin then this should be ok as the configure_db is called by each plugin in its init stage.
Maybe I am missing something?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Gary

May I ask why the db.configure is needed before plugin load?
Each plugin will call the method.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Gary

I tried that way, however it is not works.
configure_db didn't initialize _ENGINE"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Gary

Why clearing _ENGINE value is to execute db.configure_db for each plugin.
This is needed to create tables in each plugins, because db.configure_db didn't execute creating tables if _ENGINE is already set."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-28 08:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Return detail in API when VolumeNotFound Exception

when create snapshot with invaild volume id, return message "Volume ***
cound not be found" is better than message "Resource could not be
found".

impact:
* nova.api.openstack.volume.snapshots.SnapshotController.create()
* nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.volumes.SnapshotController.create()
* nova.api.openstack.volume.volumes.VolumeController.show()
* nova.api.openstack.volume.volumes.VolumeController.delete()
* nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.volumes.VolumeController.show()
* nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.volumes.VolumeController.delete()

Change-Id: I6a91f7116840875a80671cad6a63f611b12d14de

commit_message:
Remove autodoc and useless index docs

* Remove autodoc sphinx extension
* Ignore auto-generated 'api' docs
* Prevent the corresponding 'api' index from being created
* Prevent an empty 'index' page from getting generated

Related to bp glance-folsom-docs-cleanup

Change-Id: I82c9389f884ea4af853f1215731c051d1fb596e8

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I4292ba27db9371d5a8dae4b901a46165b9ee6721

http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages#Information_in_commit_messages"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-08 11:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-08 11:46:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-08 18:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What is the purpose of the tracking id sent from keystone? Is it in keystone core? is there a reason the header is capatalized differently from the other headers?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-08-08 19:35:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

I share Vish's concerns, and one question inline.

Also, could you add a test for this in nova/tests/api/test_auth.py?"}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-09 15:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Vish: 
1.The tracking id is not being sent from Keystone, it will be provided in the request. The main purpose of accepting tracking id is to locate the error in Nova API logs, if for some reason Nova API does not respond.
2.I have updated the header to upper case (similar to the other headers).

Submitting a patch with the review comment(s) addressed.'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-09 16:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-09 16:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/6806/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-docs/2626/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/7938/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/4097/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/4148/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7160/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-09 17:16:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So we discussed having an Id that existed across projects, like TRANSACTION-ID, which makes sense, and it should probably be put in keystone somehow, but I don't like exposing the ability to set the request id to the user."}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-11 05:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Abandoning, as user should not be able to set the request id.'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-13 14:02:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So, does the following sound correct:
1. Accept a TRANSACTION-ID in request header (named "X-OpenStack-Transaction-ID").
2. If user does not specify one (transaction id), set the transaction_id to request_id in Nova API (so, a new one gets generated per request). 
And this transaction_id gets passed across to other OpenStack services.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-14 06:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-14 06:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Please read my comment of Aug 13 and give your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 1633, 'date': '2012-08-14 06:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 927, 'date': '2012-08-20 14:30:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I like using the request ID as the transaction ID - except that I'd like to see a transaction ID no matter the openstack service entry point.  That is to say, if a transaction is started by talking directly to glance or quantum, a transaction ID is still generated, even though that transaction may only span the one service at the moment."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2012-08-08 10:35:39.000000000', 'message': "Implements blueprint http-notification-driver

Modified NovaKeystoneContext to set request_id in context to value provided in
request header 'X-Compute-Tracking-Id'.

Change-Id: I2dffb73a0cafafac0f646c178eeef327062b8d03
"}, {'created': '2012-08-08 11:25:00.000000000', 'message': "Set request_id in context if provided in request.

Modified NovaKeystoneContext to set request_id in context to value provided in
request header 'X-Compute-Tracking-Id' (if provided). If not provided, a new
request_id will get generated (as before).

commit_message:
Set request_id in context if provided in request.

Modified NovaKeystoneContext to set request_id in context to value provided in
request header 'X-COMPUTE-TRACKING-ID' (if provided). If not provided, a new
request_id will get generated (as before).

Implements: blueprint http-notification-driver
Change-Id: I2dffb73a0cafafac0f646c178eeef327062b8d03

Hi,
A number of comments:
1. I added the line for the include to the configuration file. This did not help. After that I noticed the following (which I should have noticed at the beginning) - the directory /op/stack/data/dhcp was not created.
2. In order to reproduce the problem you can do the following:
    i. I have a VM that is runnuning ubuntu 12.04
    ii. I am using devstack with linux bridge as the plugin:-
        1. git clone git://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack.git
        2. Go to the directory devstack. Add the following to stackrc ENABLED_SERVICES - ,q-svc,quantum,q-agt,q-dhcp. Add in the following - Q_PLUGIN=linuxbridge
LIBVIRT_FIREWALL_DRIVER=nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver
NOVA_USE_QUANTUM_API=v2
        3. In stack.sh in the q-dhscp section add in "iniset $Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE DEFAULT dhcp_driver quantum.agent.linux.isc_dhcp.IscDhcpAgent" [This is the change you will need to make for devstack)
        4. The you need to run ./stach.sh The first time you run this there may be a problem with missing packages (just run easy_install for the packages)
3. When running the dnsmasq there is no error message about an exception
Hope that this helps.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

The bug is shaky on details, why is a new class needed? There are no special functions for FloatingIps being defined, so using the IP class should suffice."}, {'account_id': 2486, 'date': '2012-08-17 00:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Hi Flavia,

Some comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-08-17 01:11:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Floating IPs are already used in the nova network model as an IP object with type = 'floating'.

They are also referred to in relation to a fixed ip as fixed_ip['floating_ips']."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-21 01:39:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi flaviamissi.  Thanks for taking a crack at this.  Two comments here: 

1) As Trey said, the goal here should be to populate the existing models for floating IPs using data using data fetched from Quantum.  No need to introduce a new model here.  

2) Looks like this change is unnecessarily stacked on top of another nova commit.  You should have separate local branches for each of your changes to nova. 

3) I've updated the launchpad bug to indicate that this affects nova (even though it was filed in quantum)."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-28 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add python-pyparsing to make python-cmd2 work.

Fixes bug 1032243

cmd2 requires pyparsing, but python-cmd2 package on Ubuntu precise
does not declare the dependency on python-pyparsing.
This is originally a bug on Ubuntu, but this fix help quantumclient
and openstackclient work properly on devstack.

Change-Id: If3ace72ee53e0c1bcf786f937d63b99b3b972c14

commit_message:
Change '_' to '-' in options

This changes every command-line option with a '_' in its name
and changes them to '-'.  The old option names are maintained
for backward compatibility but are no longer in the help text.

BP command-options

Change-Id: I79b3c03f59ce8e253aa0dcbf0c2ed5a56d71cd0c

Commit 8718f8e47d7d0504724495538eb320be3e209180 changed the
schedule_run_instance call to create all of the db records on the
compute host, but the old code path was left in for backwards
compatibility. Unfortunately an extra reservations parameter was
left in causing the backwards compatibility to be broken.

This patch takes out the reservations parameter and commits the
reservation in the backwards compatible call.

Fixes bug 1042302

Change-Id: I1e710d1e9a992f59a18eeedcd7d71726ff96c485
'}, {'created': '2012-08-27 22:46:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes backwards compatible rpc schedule_run

schedule_run_instance call to create all of the db records on the
compute host, but the old code path was left in for backwards

left in causing the backwards compatibility to be broken.

This patch takes out the reservations parameter and commits the

Fixes bug 1042302

Change-Id: I1e710d1e9a992f59a18eeedcd7d71726ff96c485

commit_message:
Fixes backwards compatible rpc schedule_run

Commit 8718f8e47d7d0504724495538eb320be3e209180 changed the
schedule_run_instance call to create all of the db records on the
compute host, but the old code path was left in for backwards
compatibility. Unfortunately an extra reservations parameter was
left in causing the backwards compatibility to be broken.

This patch takes out the reservations parameter and commits the
reservation in the backwards compatible call.

Fixes bug 1042302

Change-Id: I1e710d1e9a992f59a18eeedcd7d71726ff96c485

commit_message:
Adding additional features section to swift doc

Adds a new section for additional swift features previously
undocumented, including: healthcheck, domain remap, cname_lookup,
and tempurl.

Information on these can be scant - so I see this patch as more of
a starting point which can be added to as more becomes known.

fixes bug 994350
fixes bug 994352
fixes bug 994353
fixes bug 999405

Change-Id: I3a27ac66c107b6b7c4735f657cf72bb30cae2d74

commit_message:
Allow connecting to a ssl-based glance

This introduces a new glance_api_insecure setting that can be used to
not verify the certificate of the glance server against the certificate
authorities.

Fix bug 1042081.

Change-Id: I0a9f081425854e9c01e00dfd641e42276c878c67

commit_message:
Add ops to aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

The following operators on instance_type_extra_specs were added in
aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter. Fixes bug 1037090.

= (equal to or greater than as a number; same as vcpus case)
== (equal to as a number)
!= (not equal to as a number)
>= (greater than or equal to as a number)
<= (less than or equal to as a number)
s== (equal to as a string)
s!= (not equal to as a string)
s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
s> (greater than as a string)
s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
s< (less than as a string)
<in> (substring)
<or> (find one of these)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, a default operator "s==" is used.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

Change-Id: Iee9bf68011738aab146e6311a17cb3c673d7a392

commit_message:
Add DHCP RPC API support to Ryu plugin

It is necessary to add DHCP RPC API support to Ryu plugin to use
DHCP with Ryu plugin.

Fixes bug 1040398

Change-Id: I00caf6f36025a21d10b8a96c5f7272d12393c277
Signed-off-by: Yoshihiro Kaneko <ykaneko0929@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add lease expiration script support for dnsmasq

Fixes bug 1022804

This is phase 2 of the bug fix.  This changeset adds support for dnsmasq
 --dhcp-script to notify Quantum of lease renewals.  Communication between
dnsmasq and the Quantum DHCP agent occurs via UNIX domain socket since dnsmasq
may run in a network namespace.  The DHCP agent is responsible for
relaying the updated lease expiration back the Quantum server.

Change-Id: If42b76bbb9ec7543e681e26b9add8eb1d7054eeb

commit_message:
Correct live_migration rpc call in test

self.driver.compute_rpcapi.live_migration should be the correct
way to issue live_migration call instead of
compute_rpcapi.ComputeAPI.live_migration, because the ComputeAPI
is a class, not an instance of the class.
This technically does not matter because the method is moxed out
anyway for testing, but still it is confusing.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: Id41520a44fb9cfc19e269427ee42493e5dc52f5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-27 21:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Correct utils.execute() to check 0 in check_exit_code

If a process exits with returncode 0, the function always returns without
raising a exception, regardless of whether its check_exit_code includes 0 or
not. This patch fixes it; if check_exit_code does not includes 0 and a
process exits with 0, ProcessExecutionError is raised.

(No change required to caller-side since no one misses 0 in check_exit_code)

Change-Id: I824a9bc5e42038e27df6757cd47c06073681c342
'}]
commit_message:
Correct utils.execute() to check 0 in check_exit_code

If a process exits with returncode 0, the function always returns without
raising a exception, regardless of whether its check_exit_code includes 0 or
not. This patch fixes it; if check_exit_code does not includes 0 and a
process exits with 0, ProcessExecutionError is raised.

(No change required to caller-side since no one misses 0 in check_exit_code)

Change-Id: I824a9bc5e42038e27df6757cd47c06073681c342

commit_message:
Add test-requires in RPM package list form

This is to allow automated installation of dependences since functional
tests are not going to be run with packages from pip.

Change-Id: Ia9f74bc353bab79d7c78cb086210d8628d701387
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change '_' to '-' in options

This changes every command-line option with a '_' in its name
and changes them to '-'.  The old option names are maintained
for backward compatibility but are no longer in the help text.

BP command-options

Note: there is a dodgy hack in novaclient/shell.py to handle
usage-list's --end option that conflicts with --endpoint-type
if --endpoint_type is also present for backward compatibility.
If --endpoint_type is not added to the parser it works.  Go figure.
Better solutions that do not break backward compatibility are welcome.

Rebased due to https://review.openstack.org/11072 merging.
Note: --availability_zone changed to --availability-zone with no
backward compatability since this s a new option.

Change-Id: I09ab546659be0a0d3f0eadb22ab5e13fac2f059d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-21 06:03:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix when rate_limit_after_segment kicks in.

If rate_limit_after_segment was 10 in the proxy config, then after 10
segments were coughed up by _load_next_segment() with no calls to
sleep(), the 11th segment would not trigger a sleep() call.  The 12th
segment triggered a sleep(0) call, but it was only after the 13th

commit_message:
Fix when rate_limit_after_segment kicks in.

If rate_limit_after_segment was 10 in the proxy config, then after 10
segments were coughed up by _load_next_segment() with no calls to
sleep(), the 11th segment would not trigger a sleep() call.  The 12th
segment triggered a sleep(0) call, but it was only after the 13th
segment was loaded that an actual rate-limiting (non-zero) sleep got
called.

With this patch, a rate_limit_after_segment of 10 will start sleeping
the correct amount after the 11th segment.

Updated proxy-server.conf-sample with rate_limit_after_segment and
rate_limit_segments_per_sec.

Change-Id: I937c366996e6d6ab47c614d6db470e3be9657c07

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: Iab55c018b0f41d9ffabd931329ab487df8ab9cae

Methods:
* list() - return network list
* get(network object or id) - return requested network
* delete(network object or id) - delete requested network

* disassociate(network object or id) - disassociate the network from its project
* add(network object or id[optional]) - associate the current project with a network

commit_message:
Implement network calls in nova client

Implements blueprint novaclient-networks

Provide network API calls in nova client as well
as unit tests. API is accessed by `networks` field
of nova client.
Methods:
* list() - return network list
* get(network object or id) - return requested network
* delete(network object or id) - delete requested network
* create(network properties) - create a new network with requested
  properties
* disassociate(network object or id) - disassociate the network
  from its project
* add(network object or id[optional]) - associate the current
  project with a network

Change-Id: Ie6ab11cd2ad6e1625ead4b08c6beab5b845291a1

commit_message:
request_spec['instance_uuids'] as list in resize

Wrap instance['uuid'] in a list when building request_spec in
compute.api before sending it across to the scheduler on resize

regression introduced in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68

fixes bug 1041351

Change-Id: I7cad8316171798e240bf78999cb94730c587a904

commit_message:
Execute unit tests for Cisco plugin with Quantum tests

Bug #1041917

On account of the new requirement to run plugin-specific tests also
along with the Quantum tests, changes are being made to
incorporate the Cisco plugin unit tests into the Quantum unit test
suite. Earlier unit tests have been moved and modified.

Change-Id: I099bcaf0b2ca2f7ed7d25176dfaa75966b90dd71

The commit says it's WIP, so mark it WIP :)"}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

hmm. seems every time I upload a new review, it's no longer WIP. Need to set it again."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:34:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Seems like it could help catch bugs, for sure

Starting off with 100 exceptions is a little worrying - this may just annoy people if we get lots of false positives. Personally, though, I'm willing to give it a shot

Why did you choose to use a file with a list of exceptions rather than pylint comments in the code? Just curious, I think I may actually prefer what you've done

What you've done seems fairly generic - why couldn't this tool not be provided by pylint itself?

nova.openstack.common should be excluded from the pylinting - if we want to lint that code, we should also have pylint running in openstack-common

And if we do that, we should figure out how to move this into openstack-common so other projects can use it"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/7278/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-docs/3085/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/8397/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/4552/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/4607/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/8196/consoleFull : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@markmc: the more exceptions you have, the less complain a developer would get, so less likely to get false positives.

pylint comment has filename/lineno, those can change and is not very reliable in deciding whether a new error was seen before as noted in the exception file. It also helps to auto merge this file.

yep, will ignore nova.openstack.common next.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-16 18:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-16 19:16:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/7284/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-docs/3091/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/8403/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/4558/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/4613/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/8202/consoleFull : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-08-16 20:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd like the ability to pass further arguments to pylint.  Specifically, the "-f parseable" or "-f html" arguments.  So perhaps if lintstack just added any extra command line arguments to the lint.Run method, that should do it.

I think the command in tox.ini should be:

  python tools/lintstack.py -f parseable

(Later, we're probably going to want to change that to html.)'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-16 20:39:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Currently lintstack can only invoke pylint in the parseable format, so that it can parse the output and get rid of known errors from previous commits based on pylint_exceptions.

Do you plan to use the arguments for other purposes?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-08-16 20:52:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

When we add it to jenkins, I'd like the jenkins violations parser to be able to produce a report based on it.  As long as the parseable exceptions are sent to stdout, we should be fine.

We're working on a project to publish logs and reports of all the jenkins builds to a static web site, and in that case, it would be more useful for the jenkins run to produce an HTML report instead of the parseable text report.  If it's not too much trouble, it would be nice to have an option to produce an HTML report from this.  If that's complicated, then I think the text output should be fine -- it's pretty readable."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-17 01:47:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-17 01:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-17 02:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Add lintstack error checker based on pylint

Add a new silent test target lintstack based on pylint in Jenkins.
lintstack will compare the pylint errors between HEAD and HEAD~1,
filter out known false positives and report violations in pylint
original parseable format for Jenkins to consume.

Change-Id: Ic2962cb42a174bfe9535aea88475ff4ede3bf9ff

commit_message:
Fix column variable typo

attach_datetime is not available during downgrade. It's a copy/paste
bug from the upgrade function.

commit_message:
Implement project specific flavors API

blueprint project-specific-flavors

This change implements API extension to manage project specific flavor
types, so that non-public flavor type can only see by projects with
access rights.

Change-Id: Ie2d2c605065b0c76897f843a4548a0c984a05f1a

commit_message:
Migrate volume related quota info in db migration

  * Fixes bug 1039615
  * Now that quotas are back we need to handle migration
    of volume related quota data in the cinder-manage migrate helper
  * Only resource types transferred are volumes and gigabytes

Change-Id: Idd9aab834612e929683491f47fa1e1861bdbd0d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-23 00:07:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add ops to aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

The following operators on instance_type_extra_specs were added in
aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter. Fixes bug 1037090.

= (equal to or greater than as a number; same as vcpus case)
== (equal to as a number)
!= (not equal to as a number)
>= (greater than or equal to as a number)
<= (less than or equal to as a number)
s== (equal to as a string)
s!= (not equal to as a string)
s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
s> (greater than as a string)
s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
s< (less than as a string)
<in> (substring)
<or> (find one of these)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, a default operator "s==" is used.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

Change-Id: Ib414e26b68bd079f73959c01aa71b88baa2d108c
'}, {'created': '2012-08-23 20:46:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add ops to aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

The following operators on instance_type_extra_specs were added in
aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

!= (not equal to as a number)
>= (greater than or equal to as a number)
<= (less than or equal to as a number)
s== (equal to as a string)
s!= (not equal to as a string)
s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
s> (greater than as a string)
s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
s< (less than as a string)
<in> (substring)
<or> (find one of these)
<has> (capabilities contain this)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, a default operator "s==" is used.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

Change-Id: Ib414e26b68bd079f73959c01aa71b88baa2d108c

!= (not equal to as a number)
>= (greater than or equal to as a number)
<= (less than or equal to as a number)
s== (equal to as a string)
s!= (not equal to as a string)
s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
s> (greater than as a string)
s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
s< (less than as a string)
<in> (substring)
<or> (find one of these)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, a default operator "s==" is used.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

Change-Id: Ib414e26b68bd079f73959c01aa71b88baa2d108c
'}]
commit_message:
Add ops to aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

The following operators on instance_type_extra_specs were added in
aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter.

= (equal to or greater than as a number; same as vcpus case)
== (equal to as a number)
!= (not equal to as a number)
>= (greater than or equal to as a number)
<= (less than or equal to as a number)
s== (equal to as a string)
s!= (not equal to as a string)
s>= (greater than or equal to as a string)
s> (greater than as a string)
s<= (less than or equal to as a string)
s< (less than as a string)
<in> (substring)
<or> (find one of these)

If the first word in the instance_type_extra_spec is not one of the
keywords above, a default operator "s==" is used.

E.g.: ">= 5", "s== 2.1.0", "<in> gcc", and "<or> fpu <or> gpu"

Change-Id: Ib414e26b68bd079f73959c01aa71b88baa2d108c

commit_message:
compute info shouldn't be in object guide and vv

fixes 1026738

As noted in the bug report, some object storage content was found
in the compute guide, and the inverse was also true.

This patch separates the support and troubleshooting section in
common into three parts: common, compute and object-storage. It then
updates the guides so they have the relevant include.

Patchset rebases against (fast-moving) master.

Change-Id: I1176efea28da3f7a3e01a3e026f1a8e0517d23ce

commit_message:
Matches pom file versions to the master branch.

Patchset matches the rest of the relevant pom.xml files.
 - The api site can't build on any version higher than 1.2.1.
 - The CLI guide doesn't exist in the Essex branch, only in master.

Change-Id: I92331d6c985a1ac2a0d4242b3e92df1dda35fd94

subject: Live migration does not use libvirt's live migration.
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-10 18:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-11 03:04:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi,

When I read this, as an operator who relies on "real" live migration as a crucial part of a production system, I had a negative impression :)

I think it's important to note the behaviour, but I think we can do better than a link to a mailing list thread. This behaviour is critical for many, and the risk that the migration will not terminate is a corner case for a good deal of deployments.

Ideally, there'd be some statement on how to enable the real live migration behaviour. If this is not possible in OpenStack right now, there should be a link to a bug report.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-13 00:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-13 00:20:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I took another shot at this, but I'm also going to solicit opinion from the mailing list since I don't have the libvirt domain knowledge."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-14 18:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Just a couple of inline comments. Sort of disappointed we have to call one "true live migration" since it's tougher to write about that way. Thanks for digging in.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-14 18:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Anne: Yes, I think we need to engage the devs on what we should call this this. If it was just up to me, we would not even call this "live migration", since by default the Compute service suspends the instance. 

However, the current command is "nova-manage instance live_migration", which would cause a lot of confusion.

But perhaps it's still better to just call this "migration"?'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:45:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yeah, ugh, if the command contains "live_migration" then we have to keep it documented that way. Looking some more.'}, {'account_id': 161, 'date': '2012-08-16 19:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-17 20:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-17 20:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I decided to be bold and rename this functionality "Migration" instead of "Live Migration".'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-17 20:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Bold is Good.'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-18 03:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi - minor one:

Any comments about Xen, VMWare, HyperV etc compared to libvirt? I know this particular section is pretty kvm specific but is there anything we should be saying like "it actually works using XCP" ?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-18 03:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hey Tom:

I have no idea if migration is supported on the non-libvirt-driven hypervisors. :('}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-08-20 22:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Tom, yes, look at the matrix here :
http://wiki.openstack.org/HypervisorSupportMatrix'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 01:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'll ask about this on the mailing list."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 01:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 01:49:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I didn't ask the mailing list, but I did put a link to the docs on how to set up live migration with Xen on the wiki."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 01:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Missing Xen migration docs are a known issue: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1026676'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-27 15:17:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Great work, Lorin, very thorough with what we have. :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-27 15:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-manuals-merge/715/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-27 15:17:36.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Live migration does not use libvirt's live migration.

What OpenStack calls live migration does not use libvirt's live
migration functionality. Document that this is the case and how
to enable libvirt live migration

Also, some minor reorg and tightening of some text in the live
migration section.

New patch:
 - Changes the name from "Live Migration" to "Migration"
 - Mentions that Xen also supports (live) migration, points to wikki

Change-Id: Ieb5bc3079ec7523512b58ef4bc5de4c5a3ce4419

> Proposed change to nova: https://review.openstack.org/10579

Note that the change is for _keystone_ where auth_token middleware is currently located (under discussion to move it to openstack-common aka oslo)

As I commented in change 10579 I think it's safe to get this keystone change in Folsom but not to change the sample config files in Nova or Glance before Grizzly.

But this does not affect openstack-install manual since it provides its own sample config files, which are correctly modified by this change."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 02:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-23 02:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
No longer need to edit api-paste.ini

A recent change in keystone would mean that keystone auth stuff
could be specified in nova.conf, so there would be no need to edit
api-paste.ini.

Change to keystone: https://review.openstack.org/10579

Change-Id: Ic61d1261e24cf57ec7345d706020356526fea2cf

commit_message:
Functional test improvements

-Move everything out of init so unit tests are not affected.
-Make JEOS creation part of utils class, now tests can choose
which JEOS to use.
-Only attempt to create JEOS if a suitable one is not found in glance.

Change-Id: I162e7447ae1fed17855bdca8eba16ac7f952db01
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
use underscores in log options, log options table

Some log-related config options incorrectly had hyphens instead
of underscores. For example:

log-config -> log_config

Also, move these options to the table that deals with logging.

Refs:
bug #1034970
nova: https://review.openstack.org/11863

Change-Id: I548e517f1cfa6bca0a944181f059d4ea7d0329c5

commit_message:
Fix typo in call in cinder.API unreserve_volume

Fixes bug #1038599

def unreserve_volume(self, context, volume):
-    cinderclient(context).volumes.reserve(volume['id'])
+    cinderclient(context).volumes.unreserve(volume['id'])

Change-Id: Ida96b01d93f2e82fe842fa93c1a8edbc27434279

commit_message:
Remove test_keypair_create_quota_limit()

test_keypair_create_quota_limit() is defined twice. The two tests
are not exactly the same but functionally equivallent. Remove the
first definition.

Partially fix bug 1037183

commit_message:
Fix the way self.properties is checked for a value.

The following only checks if the key is in the properties, and
all schema keys are, so it is not the way to check if a value
has been set.

if 'DesiredCapacity' in self.properties:
change to:
if self.properties:

Fixes: #199

Change-Id: I6bcb3e74420031532dc249aafe85d5a428d0a80e
Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set the max url length in eventlet 0.9.17

The version with configurable url limit was released and packaged for
Fedora 17.

The monkey-patch does not work on new eventlet.

ref #55
fixes #197

Change-Id: I728cc3b0851261667bb9b07220c855bced1344a4
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

Remove the option to run with quantum-rootwrap as the root_helper in
Quantum agents. This is currently not fully working and would introduce
confusion since it's not working the same way as Folsom nova and cinder
rootwrap versions.

Implements blueprint quantum-remove-rootwrap

Change-Id: I565e853fe2ac9d560a6d457d698e73b45c179bc2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove non-functioning quantum-rootwrap

Remove the option to run with quantum-rootwrap as the root_helper in
Quantum agents. This is currently not fully working and would introduce
confusion since it's not working the same way as Folsom nova and cinder
rootwrap versions.

Implements blueprint quantum-remove-rootwrap

Change-Id: I565e853fe2ac9d560a6d457d698e73b45c179bc2

Hey Lorin, thinking about reviving this "where do I start" by putting links to a  list of "getting started" documents at http://www.openstack.org/software/start/.  I'd also move the "Starter Guide" here and make it the "Beginner's Guide" so that it isn't mistaken as "official" documentation that doc-core maintains. Thoughts? I can also take this to the mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-07 17:25:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Anne: Sounds good to me. I'm going to change it from Draft to WIP so that anybody can see it, right now only people who are invited have it visible."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-07 17:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This is a work in progress. Please comment, propose alternate designs, etc.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-07 17:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Anne: To be more explicit, I'm also supportive of changing the "Starter's Guide" to "Beginner's Guide"'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-07 17:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could even call it "The Unofficial Beginner's Guide..."'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-07 18:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Specifically, I'm going to point to https://cssoss.wordpress.com/2012/05/07/openstack-beginners-guide-v3-0-for-essex-on-ubuntu-12-04-precise-pangolin/ instead of re-branding the "Starter Guide" - the content is the same, the output is different.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-08 19:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-08 19:46:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If we like this overall effect, we'll need to update the other index.html pages and also move content to api.openstack.org."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-12 02:22:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I feel like the addition of the panel on the left and the comments on the bottom makes this page feel too noisy, it's more effort for a reader to navigate. I personally like something that's a little bit sparser to make it easier to navigate.

How about something like the Brightbox top-level doc page? http://docs.brightbox.com

You'd have to click through to another level to get at the docs you want, but I think the alternative is information overload."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-12 13:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have a second mock up here: 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11232/'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-27 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

and api.openstack.org. Also removes the "Starter Guide" after
discussing with the CSS team about its licensing and fitting into
"official" documentation processes.

Also adds the Disqus widget - see what you think.

commit_message:
Addeded "where do I start" language

Adds some "where do I start" language bottom of docs.openstack.org

Patchset adds link to http://www.openstack.org/software/start/,
and api.openstack.org. Also removes the "Starter Guide" after
discussing with the CSS team about its licensing and fitting into
"official" documentation processes.

Also adds the Disqus widget - see what you think.

Since there are only 950 px in the grid, there's no way to do a sidebar
unless we chop off the API Documentation. I think it's time to place
all API content on one site, so this could be a good new nav.

Also puts "OpenStack Official Documentation" as the main heading.

Would love reviews and feedback.

Change-Id: Icca30e9955efa0f36e2b7ca0d910ecda926fdfbf

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I45191e872a41eed8e6a9e14757675ee7a28b3836

commit_message:
Make instance_update_and_get_original() atomic

Use the same session object within a transaction to retrieve
and update the instance object, including metadata and system
metadata.

In preparation to fix bug 1037372

Change-Id: I886da12bb85f60c2b23609a35b6d9a43040216ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 20:00:52.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused permitted_instance_types

Commit 5ea7db9b removed the ArchFilter and moved its functionality
to the ImagePropertiesFilter, which uses 'supported_instances' from
the compute nodes to determine if a node satisfies the arch,
preferred hypervisor, and virtual machine mode requested by the
instance.  permitted_instance_types is no longer used and can be
removed.

Change-Id: Idf9d72746d7c3dcd2a7385913823df122eaa7cd6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused permitted_instance_types

Commit 5ea7db9b removed the ArchFilter and moved its functionality
to the ImagePropertiesFilter, which uses 'supported_instances' from
the compute nodes to determine if a node satisfies the arch,
preferred hypervisor, and virtual machine mode requested by the
instance.  permitted_instance_types is no longer used and can be
removed.

Change-Id: Idf9d72746d7c3dcd2a7385913823df122eaa7cd6

fixes bug 1032118

In class ExtensionManager
The path for example implemetation of an extension should be

instead of
nova/tests/api/openstack/extensions/foxinsocks/extension.py

which no longer exists.

This affects the documentation at:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api/nova.api.openstack.extensions.html#nova.api.openstack.extensions.ExtensionManager

Change-Id: I81083b2a67a3db6e394bc919470e5f1d2dd7ac88
'}]
commit_message:
Fix path to example extension implementation

fixes bug 1032118

In class ExtensionManager
The path for example implemetation of an extension should be
nova/tests/api/openstack/volume/extensions/foxinsocks.py
instead of
nova/tests/api/openstack/extensions/foxinsocks/extension.py

which no longer exists.

This affects the documentation at:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/api/nova.api.openstack.extensions.html#nova.api.openstack.extensions.ExtensionManager

Change-Id: I81083b2a67a3db6e394bc919470e5f1d2dd7ac88

commit_message:
Make RDS (mysql) wait until setup is finished before proceeding

It is possible a service dependent on RDS may issue commands to
the RDS service before mysql has finished installing.  Added
a wait condition to force synchronization.

Change-Id: I6abf2d62e92d19945c587deeb61605df2c97ec85
Signed-off-by: Steven Dake <sdake@redhat.com>

bug 1041669

the fact that these plugins ever cleared this field is probably just a

Change-Id: Ie9579e2f88d322cfdce51a2ca126f4dfab680022
"}]
commit_message:
prevent OVS + LB plugins from clearing device_id and device_owner

bug 1041669

the fact that these plugins ever cleared this field is probably just a
misunderstanding of how the field is supposed to be used, as I don't think
it ever makes sense for the L2 plugin logic to change this field.

Change-Id: Ie9579e2f88d322cfdce51a2ca126f4dfab680022

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-08-25 11:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Well Mount is really an abstract mixin class,
and the subclasses all define 'mode'.
So there is no actual bug here, but I agree
that we should define a default mode to placate pylint.
I would suggest the following instead.

thanks!

diff --git a/nova/virt/disk/mount.py b/nova/virt/disk/mount.py
index be2f22b..d24275a 100644
--- a/nova/virt/disk/mount.py
+++ b/nova/virt/disk/mount.py
@@ -30,6 +30,8 @@ class Mount(object):
     to be called in that order.
     """
 
+    mode = device_id_string = None
+
     def __init__(self, image, mount_dir, partition=None, device=None):
 
         # Input'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-25 12:47:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Define default mode and device_id_string in Mount

self.mode is not a valid class member in the Mount abstract class,
but used in map_dev(). Although all the subclasses define it so
there is no runtime bug, define it to avoid confusion and
better readability.

Do the same thing for device_id_string as precaution too.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: Ica32db1ca17c6ed967f2c310b1d54adeb5f4247c

commit_message:
Correct param comments in docstring

Some methods in cinderclient/v1/volumes.VolumeManager have 'volume'
paramter, but in docstring the paramter is 'server'. So change ":param
server:" to ":param volume:".

Change-Id: I75a86180a830d3ae875ee1aecd45f9a6e39f6e22

[{'created': '2012-08-23 09:50:11.000000000', 'message': "Include CommonConfigOpts options in sample config

Options defined by CommonConfigOpts are declared within the class rather
than at module level, so they weren't being included in the sample conf.

Also, in essex (and up until commit 991614add8), the sample conf file
didn't contain these options but they included the hyphen in the name.
The hyphen is only used on the command line, it is converted to an
underscore automatically in the config file. Use opt.dest rather than
opt.name as the config file key. Fixes bug #1034970.

DocImpact: update nova.conf docs

commit_message:
Include CommonConfigOpts options in sample config

Options defined by CommonConfigOpts are declared within the class rather
than at module level, so they weren't being included in the sample conf.

Also, in essex (and up until commit 991614add8), the sample conf file
didn't contain these options but they included the hyphen in the name.
The hyphen is only used on the command line, it is converted to an
underscore automatically in the config file. Use opt.dest rather than
opt.name as the config file key. Fixes bug #1034970.

DocImpact: update nova.conf docs
Change-Id: Ia7f3dded9148deedeb198c19a8d343db6dd93f99

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-23 10:40:06.000000000', 'message': "Re-work the handling of firewall_driver default

Fixes bug #1040430

We have a different default firewall driver for libvirt and
xenapi, yet the sample config file currently contains:

  firewall_driver=nova.virt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver

In the case of libvirt, it should actually be:

  firewall_driver=nova.virt.firewall.libvirt.IptablesFirewallDriver

This is really easy for users to get confused about.

Since we don't have a different sample config file for each hypervisor,
the best we can do is to just not include the default in the sample
config and have each hypervisor supply its default at runtime.

Change-Id: Ie78371bcceac5a65978d695934e0246022f748a3

commit_message:
Re-work the handling of firewall_driver default

Fixes bug #1040430

We have a different default firewall driver for libvirt and
xenapi, yet the sample config file currently contains:

  firewall_driver=nova.virt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver

In the case of libvirt, it should actually be:

  firewall_driver=nova.virt.firewall.libvirt.IptablesFirewallDriver

This is really easy for users to get confused about.

Since we don't have a different sample config file for each hypervisor,
the best we can do is to just not include the default in the sample
config and have each hypervisor supply its default at runtime.

DocImpact: update nova.conf docs
Change-Id: Ie78371bcceac5a65978d695934e0246022f748a3

commit_message:
Remove 'verbose' API capability

Fixes bug 1040568

Remove parsing of "verbose" query param from API layer
Remove "verbose" fetching from db in db_base_plugin
Remove "verbose" parameter from plugin methods

Change-Id: I5826fd64c7d8c48f4da605f32d21d96280c4c9f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 22:00:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken SimpleScheduler.schedule_run_instance()

 * The fix for bug 1037829 broke SimpleScheduler by unnecessarily
   including the 'self' parameter in the invocation of the parent's
   schedule_run_instance().  This change removes the 'self' parameter.
 * Addresses bug 1041385

Change-Id: I95b28fce9b17b6c1d9ca2f19cd83608cde8479ee
"}, {'created': '2012-08-24 22:07:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken SimpleScheduler.schedule_run_instance()

 * The fix for 1037829 broke SimpleScheduler by unnecessarily
   including the 'self' parameter in the invocation of the parent's
   schedule_run_instance().  This change removes the 'self' parameter.
 * Addresses bug 1041385

Change-Id: I95b28fce9b17b6c1d9ca2f19cd83608cde8479ee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken SimpleScheduler.schedule_run_instance()

 * The fix for 1037829 broke SimpleScheduler by unnecessarily
   including the 'self' parameter in the invocation of the parent's
   schedule_run_instance().  This change removes the 'self' parameter.
 * Addresses bug 1041385

Change-Id: I95b28fce9b17b6c1d9ca2f19cd83608cde8479ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 21:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'Rename class_name to project_id

project_id is the variable used in the actual code, which is not
defined without this patch.
This bug is never caught because quota_usage_update seems to be
no longer in use.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: I42a279489de75128e7acf09fd05873e73846d272
'}]
commit_message:
Rename class_name to project_id

project_id is the variable used in the actual code, which is not
defined without this patch.
This bug is never caught because quota_usage_update seems to be
no longer in use.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: I42a279489de75128e7acf09fd05873e73846d272

commit_message:
Use the compute_rpcapi instance not the module

compute_rpcapi.get_console_pool_info is only available from
the ComputeAPI object, not nova.compute.rpcapi module.

Partially fix bug 1037183

Change-Id: I57df710389bf349c7ba1dd7980105222918bff92

is missing.

Partially fix bug 1037183

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-19 14:17:49.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly re-raise exception on bad v1 checksum

The exception re-raise during v1 image upload operation was
failing due to some weirdness in _safe_kill. This patches over
the problem by explicitly re-raising the caught exception object
after doing the necessary teardown.

Fixes bug 1036470

Change-Id: I0929bb3b2ac88f0b80f47eb61e642fe1fee35218
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly re-raise exception on bad v1 checksum

The exception re-raise during v1 image upload operation was
failing due to some weirdness in _safe_kill. This patches over
the problem by explicitly re-raising the caught exception object
after doing the necessary teardown.

Fixes bug 1036470

Change-Id: I0929bb3b2ac88f0b80f47eb61e642fe1fee35218

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I811f56c37218301c4c5bd25bae92a4b5b74537de

commit_message:
Trap iscsiadm error

If the iscsitarget was previously deleted and the user tries
to delete the iscsi target again, then you get a nasty traceback
in the logfiles.

According to the iscsiadm man page, iscsiadm returns an error 21,
ISCSI_ERR_NO_OBJS_FOUND if there is no records/targets/sessions/portals
found to execute the operation on.

LP: #1011166

Change-Id: I3087c1a114fe91bd7361d92688d4f926bc3f8951
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

status before preforming the detach. Otherwise you get a nasty

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Check volume status before detaching.

If the volume is already detached previously, check the volume
status before preforming the detach. Otherwise you get a nasty
traceback because the instance_uuid no longer exists.

Change-Id: I0df4240fb6500d5f99a20d63d82fd258fccdc9fc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
