revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 22:30:15.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sure deletion works with deleted data

Commit 5ad1dea4 added changed the network deallocation code to
work with deleted instances. This was done by setting the context
to read deleted records. Unfortunately this was done a little too
broadly, leading to a new bug where a deleted floating_ip will
cause an instance to not be able to be deleted.

This fixes the issue by limiting the use of read_deleted context
to only the places it is trying to access the instance record. It
adds a test  to verify that the code works with a duplicate
deleted floating_ip and updates the existing test for a deleted
instance to exercise the entire code path.

Fixes bug 1038266

Change-Id: I1aef94369e5bcf951e78e89b1eded5305cf36b53
(cherry-picked from commit c849d495d0e3e72a1f526e0608586271b7c8aaf0)

commit_message:
Makes sure instance deletion ok with deleted data

Commit 5ad1dea4 added changed the network deallocation code to
work with deleted instances. This was done by setting the context
to read deleted records. Unfortunately this was done a little too
broadly, leading to a new bug where a deleted floating_ip will
cause an instance to not be able to be deleted.

This fixes the issue by limiting the use of read_deleted context
to only the places it is trying to access the instance record. It
adds a test  to verify that the code works with a duplicate
deleted floating_ip and updates the existing test for a deleted
instance to exercise the entire code path.

Fixes bug 1038266

Change-Id: I1aef94369e5bcf951e78e89b1eded5305cf36b53
(cherry-picked from commit 1f98e28a80077760394201f79de04a0924b9ad3f)

commit_message:
Simplify network create logic

The logic to determine default values for num_networks and network_size
is currently overly convoluted. Simplify it in order to make the intent
more clear, without actually changing the behaviour.

Change-Id: Iadb83b1a45aaf52822ee34b972b3f004cef65ef3

The NetworkManager code will not raise webob exceptions, so there's no
point in explicitly catching those.

Also, the contrib.networks module is unused in nova-manage.

Change-Id: I5f9fe7fa7f4365f44e7a70b3d9536da8f10b8fa7
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up network create exception handling

The NetworkManager code will not raise webob exceptions, so there's no
point in explicitly catching those.

Also, the contrib.networks module is unused in nova-manage.

Change-Id: I5f9fe7fa7f4365f44e7a70b3d9536da8f10b8fa7

commit_message:
Ensure hairpin_mode is set whenever vifs is added to bridge.

Fix the bug that when create a snapshot of an instance, the
instance cann't ping it's floating ip.
fix bug lp:1040537

Change-Id: I25aa1a323fa84e8c72f969cb56ada4dffa509150

commit_message:
Returns hypervisor_hostname in xml of extension

The extended_server_attributes extension returns hypervisor_hostname
in json output, but it was inadvertently omitted from xml. This makes
the output consistent between the two. Tests included.

Fixes bug 1039276

Change-Id: Ib8cd71cd5bfb65785a02085061fea5e515a0568c

'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-24 13:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If the stated goal here is to ensure that "the samples at api.openstack.org are actually correct," how do we get corrected ones copied to the openstack-manuals project? Open to any and all methods, automatic preferred of course. 

Also, how do we ensure coverage of all samples for all core and extensions? 

For coverage I'm just looking for ideas. For copying samples, I don't want to accept this patch without having a good clean mechanism in place.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-24 15:17:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Anne, my €0.02c

The goal here is more about testing the actual API behaviour against the specified behaviour

Where we'll need to sync from the samples in Nova to the samples in openstack-manuals is when new functionality is added. We can certainly help to figure out a good process here, but that syncing isn't the main goal here. Also, I don't see that we'd block something like adding nova.conf.sample until we had a way to sync it into the docs.

On coverage, AIUI Vish is intending to add more tests once the infrastructure is in place."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-08-24 17:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-24 20:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Anne: We discussed trying to get the coverage up in the nova meeting. I haven't had time to send out an update about it. Start is at an etherpad here:

http://etherpad.openstack.org/api-samples

We really need this branch in so people can start helping. For now I think the copying into manuals will have to be by hand. I will propose them in once we have them all finished. Once they are all in the samples should not be changing at all unless there are bugs or new extensions added, so i think it won't be too painful to manually sync them in the short term."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-24 21:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

getting this in so we can move ahead!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-24 21:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-24 21:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified

commit_message:
Adds integration testing for api samples

We have no validation the the samples at api.openstack.org are
actually correct. This creates a framework to validate the request
and response samples through integration tests.

Adds a bit of stubbing in fake_network to return simple network_info
along with instance records and adds a call in image/fake to get
av valid image.

It will create non-templated versions of the samples when
the tests are running if GENERATE_SAMPLES is set in the environment
when running  nova/tests/integrated/test_api_samples.py

Change-Id: Id134af0b23f0d0932c8789697439ce94bbe2834b

commit_message:
fixes cisco nexus plugin delete network issue

Fixes bug 1039687

Removes the vlan from the nexus interface corresponding to the network that has been deleted.
unit tests added.

Change-Id: Ib58a01c7b5bbdd7aac8591b4fb4db123cbe8f55b

So, some of these indexes might have been added by someone in production already. If that has happened, will this fail and wedge the migration? Is there a way to gracefully handle that."}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2012-08-07 16:42:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So, having multiple indexes created on the same table and column, while not ideal, will not wedge a system (the create command will complete successfully). 

However, attempting to create a new index with the same name as an existing index will cause a 'Duplicate key name' error (for MySQL).

I could wrap all index creation in a try/except for IntegrityError errors for upgrades.. but I am unsure how to handle for downgrades.. as the index would not exist.. It could end up in a odd state.

Would appreciate any feedback on how to best handle this."}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2012-08-07 16:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-07 17:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/3947/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/3998/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/6883/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think try/except on downgrade is acceptable as well. If someone had custom indexes and they went through an upgrade and then manually downgraded, they can be responsible for readding them imo.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (8 inline comments)

I think this is a great start, though I have several suggestions on specific tables/indexes. 

There is a much larger list of missing indexes (http://bit.ly/OxxAKX) that should be taken into consideration; if that list is too large to address now, this patch is still a good improvement.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-08-07 19:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

On the upgrade path, try/except is fine. I was more worried about the exact same name is, not duplicate but differently named indexes. The same name issue actually hit a real user in one of the earlier index add migrations I put in, so it does happen.

Downgrade, I agree with Vish. If you downgrade, it might remove your custom indexes, not much we can do about it.'}, {'account_id': 1032, 'date': '2012-08-08 03:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

Add '--availability_zone' flag to 'create' sub command in order to allow

Change-Id: Ie20760cdbf6a8fa5869ed5e79dc0ac56d2741cb2
"}]
commit_message:
Add availability_zone support for volume creation.

Add '--availability_zone' flag to 'create' sub command in order to allow
user to speicify target availability zone for volume.

Change-Id: Ie20760cdbf6a8fa5869ed5e79dc0ac56d2741cb2

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-swift-merge/497/consoleFull : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 00:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

When I run the unit test without the fix to swift/proxy/server.py, I see two Errno 32 Broken pipe exceptions, but the test still passes (bad).  With the fix in place, the unit test still has a single Broken pipe exception (and still passes).

The test should actually fail without the fix, and when it passes with the fix, there should be no exception output on STDERR (or STDOUT).  Ideally, the exception shouldn't happen, but if it's expected for some reason, expect it with assertRaises().

Exception with code and test in the patch (should pass w/no exceptions):

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenpool.py", line 80, in _spawn_n_impl
    func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 514, in process_request
    proto = self.protocol(socket, address, self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/SocketServer.py", line 641, in __init__
    self.finish()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/wsgi.py", line 456, in finish
    BaseHTTPServer.BaseHTTPRequestHandler.finish(self)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/SocketServer.py", line 694, in finish
    self.wfile.flush()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/socket.py", line 303, in flush
    self._sock.sendall(view[write_offset:write_offset+buffer_size])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenio.py", line 307, in sendall
    tail = self.send(data, flags)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenio.py", line 286, in send
    total_sent += fd.send(data[total_sent:], flags)
error: [Errno 32] Broken pipe'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 00:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI, adding this test line right after the existing assertEqual() clears up the "Broken pipe" exception in the passing case:

self.assertEqual(''.join(res.body), obj)

But it's still disturbing that the test case doesn't actually fail when the patch isn't applied (you just see traceback output).'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-08-23 01:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/Vl26X1ChebVxA1T2qpwT/'}, {'account_id': 5410, 'date': '2012-08-24 17:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Corrected patch commited here:
https://review.openstack.org/11938

I have fixed the test now it fails correctly'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-08-24 18:22:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Oh okay, thanks!! Much better than me trying to do this. :)'}]

commit_message:
Return actual availability zones

Report on real availability zones, not a hard coded "nova" zone in
the output of ec2 DescribeAvailabilityZones when the output is
verbose. Resolves bug 1032890.

Change-Id: Ie85cfa1c3638fc490f52f48c8238b3162732647d

commit_message:
Check association when removing floating ip.

Fixes bug 1032558 and returns 404 when trying to delete a floating ip
from an instance to which it is not associated.

Change-Id: I30b4d8a318597d38c7afc01ee6d2e6842b999157

commit_message:
Change '_' to '-' in options

This changes every command-line option with a '_' in its name
and changes them to '-'.  The old option names are maintained
for backward compatibility but are no longer in the help text.

BP command-options

Change-Id: I94daea544ab613321c0a1c4de45092be6dc8471d

[{'created': '2012-08-23 11:03:49.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure log formats are quoted in sample conf

This ensures the sample conf has:

  # instance_format="[instance: %(uuid)s] "

rather than:

  # instance_format=[instance: %(uuid)s]

Fix suggested by Vish.

Change-Id: If20aa7276d6868a6885abc85f046733adc40331f
DocImpact: update nova.conf docs
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure log formats are quoted in sample conf

Fixes bug #1040583

This ensures the sample conf has:

  # instance_format="[instance: %(uuid)s] "

rather than:

  # instance_format=[instance: %(uuid)s]

Fix suggested by Vish.

Change-Id: If20aa7276d6868a6885abc85f046733adc40331f
DocImpact: update nova.conf docs

[{'created': '2012-08-22 23:20:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add two prereq pkgs to nova devref env guide

fixes bug 1024903

As noted in the bug report, without libxml2-dev and libxslt-dev
installed on ubuntu 12.04, the virtualenv creation will fail.

This fix simply adds the packages to the first
"Install the prerequisite packages." line

Change-Id: I588ce14f63fa75d54405562f83d202d05c8a05c6
'}]
commit_message:
Add two prereq pkgs to nova devref env guide

fixes bug 1024903

As noted in the bug report, without libxml2-dev and libxslt-dev
installed on ubuntu 12.04, the virtualenv creation will fail.

This fix simply adds the packages to the first
"Install the prerequisite packages." line

Change-Id: I588ce14f63fa75d54405562f83d202d05c8a05c6

commit_message:
XCP-XAPI version fix

Fixes bug 1033933.

On an Kronos installation (Ubuntu + XCP-XAPI), the reported
software_version dictionary did not contain both product_version and
product_brand. This caused a KeyError. With this fix, the session's
product_version and product_brand will default to None in such cases.
The resize operation's name in these cases will default to VDI.resize.

Change-Id: Ic0db4128a7b27c08c24461562423bcecd1373e58

(6 inline comments)

Nice work Alessio!

I've added some fairly basic comments inline.

Two bigger issues concern me:

1) Whether we need to support creating multiple networks through the API and, if we do, how to do it in a RESTful way: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-July/000116.html

2) This code is copied-and-pasted from nova-manage. I don't want two copies of this code around the place. It should be possible to refactor the code so that it can be shared between nova-manage and the API.

Finally, your commit message is very sparse - please include more details. See https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg13742.html"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-19 17:02:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Why should we introduce an artificial restriction in REST API?'}, {'account_id': 2998, 'date': '2012-08-15 07:40:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1053, 'date': '2012-08-15 08:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-15 08:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

It's pretty basic stuff IMHO

REST stands for Representational State Transfer

When you POST to /networks, you are sending a representation of the network resource you want to create

The sensible thing for a client to expect is that a network resource will be created and for a 201 Created response to include a representation the resource and a Location header with a URI for the resource

What doesn't seem at all sensible is for the server to return a collection of resources, based on "num_networks" and "network_size" properties in the network representation and also based on the server configuration


Let's turn this around the other way - what important use case do you see for the ability to create multiple networks with a single POST request?


You've done a lot of really nice work here, and I don't think it will take much to change it so that we only support creating a single network - you basically want the API extension to pass num_networks=1 to network.api.API.create() and also have some way of ensuring that multiple networks aren't created irrespective of FLAGS.num_networks and FLAGS.network_size

What would be really nice is if NetworkManager could have a create_network() method which only creates a single network and the create_networks() method is implemented using create_network()'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-15 08:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (1 inline comment)

+1 to marks suggestion. POST should be creating one object at a time. You can have a very simple client script that creates a bunch of networks.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-15 20:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Doc question: Does the nova-manage command itself change? Or is this going on in the background?

Would users want to know the API commands through the extension? My guess is yes.

Please amend the commit message with DocImpact if you think these two questions need answered in the documentation.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-16 22:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

This was granted an FFE if marks changes can be implemented.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-20 16:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Implement network creation in compute API

Implements blueprint os-api-network-create

The ability to create new networks is currently only exposed by the
nova-manage CLI. Here we add support for network creation in the
os-networks API extension.

With the exception of num_networks and network_size, all the parameters
supported by 'nova-manage network create' are supported. Only a single
network may be created by each API call.

To avoid code duplication, the nova-manage code is refactored and moved
into NetworkManager so that it can be re-used by the API.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I682d498ab35ea43b553b64e13e677fe9eeb8e08b

22:38:44  ----------------------------------------------------------------------
22:38:44  Traceback (most recent call last):

22:38:44      "'key43328630537' != 'None'" = '%s != %s' % (safe_repr('key43328630537'), safe_repr('None'))

commit_message:
Add an xml/servers_client.py implementation

This needs to inherit some common bits from the json implementation,
but works for now.

This changes openstack.py::Manager to take an interface argument and
select the appropriate client(s) accordingly. This is ugly, and probably
not the best approach, but for the moment, it avoids the class inflation
that would result from creating subclasses at the Manager _and_ Base*Test
layers.

Change-Id: I7814054eab59bc34258fbbd1df43a4140448f448

heat API : make extract_user_params more generic

Make api.aws.utils.extract_user_params into a more
generic aws-format-list-extraction function

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: Ic19030cc4cc8fcf99ee9442de175f38ac6126776

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: Ic19030cc4cc8fcf99ee9442de175f38ac6126776

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I6d217ff3098650e013985afdd8f4186d8d77d609

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 06:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Enable users to list subnets on shared networks

Fixes bug 1039591

This patch will enable regular users to list subnets on a shared
network by exposing the subnet's "shared" attribute to the policy
engine, and letting it applying different rules if the subnet is
shared or private.

Change-Id: If204f1e352c114e16251586c743f5b7fe2d1ad7d
'}]
commit_message:
Enable users to list subnets on shared networks

Fixes bug 1039591

This patch will enable regular users to list subnets on a shared
network by exposing the subnet's "shared" attribute to the policy
engine, and letting it applying different rules if the subnet is
shared or private.

Change-Id: If204f1e352c114e16251586c743f5b7fe2d1ad7d

commit_message:
blueprint atmos-storage-adapter

Initial review of Glance Storage Adapter for the EMC
Atmos Object Storage system. Atmos is very similar to Amazon S3
or Swift in that it has a RESTful API for Storage of objects.

Initial code includes the esu.py storage adapter that allows for the
creatation, deletion, and download of images stored in Atmos.

It also includes a full test suite.

Follow up work will need to be done on the store_utils.py to
follow other storage adapter tests

Change-Id: Ib9aecd4f359fa88d0a0e0c2c3bac4bd15eb3ff34

Change-Id: I03f61fe4a8f0daa4a43fc9e7d41456b65018cf66

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs
on a different server.

Change-Id: I03f61fe4a8f0daa4a43fc9e7d41456b65018cf66

commit_message:
Exercise quantum v2 api without namespace

Added quantum_v2.sh for quantum v2 api exercise.

Quantum exercise script requires the following settings:
- Q_USE_NAMESPACE=False
- LIBVIRT_FIREWALL_DRIVER=nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver

And the following services enabled:
- quantum, q-svc, q-agt, q-dhcp

Change-Id: I5767f94c94187a4ca0fd189244fa6f5781519ab4

commit_message:
Add glance/versioninfo to MANIFEST.in.

Fixes bug #1040734

Adding glance/versioninfo to MANIFEST.in adds the versioninfo file to
sdist packages. Adding this file to sdist packages allows versioning to
work properly when installing from an sdist package.

Change-Id: I7c9d2843e428fb0da1ffb461410c75a25a6e51d0

commit_message:
Split functional test into standalone and utility class

This allows functional tests to be written for each individual template.
See the test_Wordpress_Single_Instance for an example, but the basic
form to follow is:

import util

def test_template():
    func_utils = util.FuncUtils()

    func_utils.create_stack(template, 'F17')
    func_utils.check_cfntools()
    func_utils.wait_for_provisioning()
    func_utils.check_user_data(template)

    ssh = func_utils.get_ssh_client()

    # test stuff here

    func_utils.cleanup()

Functional test changes:
Changed jeos creation to use new tool.
Added distribution to heat stack creation.
Improved IP parsing from glance.
Improve SSH connection exception handling.
Changed cfntools SHA check to match installed copy instead of locally.
Fixed stack parsing to check correct file and handle user-data injection.

Clean up run_tests a little to make it clear default execution is on host.
Add a short option for unit test running only (may be important due to not
wanting to run functional tests locally).

Also added paramiko to test-requires.

Change-Id: Ib2ae1be32801cb0ee3d1937c4f82ab9f574b4591
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

classes to their own files.

'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-23 05:10:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'm on the fence about this change. I definitely agree that some type of logging to let the operator know that there were resources that were not properly deleted. On the other hand, if for diagnostic purposes you wanted to keep servers around after the test run, this becomes a global on/off switch across the board. I'm interested to hear other opinions on this."}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2012-08-23 13:21:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-08-23 13:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The problem for me is that sometimes I can't get a full run of tempest in on my devstack VM because it leaks so many instances and I run out of memory. Other times, it causes spurious failures because one "small" guest was left around, so tests that create one "tiny" are okay, but any that create two fail.

So, I know it's a big change, and I'm not married to it, it just helped me so I figured I'd at least float it.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-08-23 14:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There has been previous discussion of cleaning up resources. I had advocated that tests not have to keep track of their resources unless they used a lot, and that the resources be "garbage collected" at the end. This was tricky before but, as you pointed out, with tenant isolation it is pretty easy. So on balance I like this change. But two things:

1. We should be cleaning all resources such as floating ips, etc.
2. To get parallelism, the server delete loop should be two loops: the first to call delete and the second to wait for them to finish.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-08-23 15:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 16:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Attempt to clean up any servers we left behind after a test

This lists and deletes any servers still in our list during
tearDownClass().

Change-Id: I113bee5019eb387d2ae2539e783f550d8c34ce6d

Thanks Daryl!"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-20 01:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-23 19:36:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

This looks fine, but I do have one question. I see how in this and subsequent code submissions the functionality for XML serialization/deserialization is added, but where is the control mechanism to determine if the tests are run using XML or JSON requests and responses? There are quite a few dependent merge props and I'm having a hard time seeing the larger picture."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-08-23 19:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Cool, thanks Daryl!

In each test at the end of my chain, the base case is subclassed into two, one for JSON and one for XML. That means each test runs twice, one for each dialect. That approach was handed down to me by Jay directly, and is used in some other glance testing that he did with similar goals.'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:23:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

This would have a profound effect on the execution time of the tests (realistically doubling the run time). I haven't spoken with Jay, but making it such that there is no choice about how the tests is very undesirable to me. Is there a reason why this choice was made?"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-08-23 20:33:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Well, I started out asking Jay how he wanted to implement the JSON-or-XML switch and he asked me to do it this way. We could certainly mark all of the XML test classes with @SKIP(unless-xml-is-enabled) if you like.

The argument he made, which I think is reasonable, is that we're doing CI, which means, noticing when something breaks. I didn't initially think it would be as easy to run them all side-by-side, but his solution was easy to implement.

Perhaps we go with the SKIP() option so we can start getting these into the tree and then we can follow up with Jay when he returns?"}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-23 21:58:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I really don't want to hold up the pipeline, and this is something we can adjust on the fly. Something as group (myself included) we need to do better as is to use blueprints as a means to better discuss larger efforts such as this before implementation."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-08-23 22:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Looks good so far. Will need to see this in the context of running tests before I can make sure there's no other issues."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 22:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 22:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 22:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified

commit_message:
Add a RestClient variant that sends and expects XML

For now, this leaves the base class as defaulting to JSON and
just adds RestClientXML as a variant that does XMLish things.

This adds a headers argument to get and delete so that we can
declare to the API that we speak XML.

Also, add some common XML utilities.

Change-Id: I883de8e21ae18eed929705cff49b6dfb112d20c2

commit_message:
make obj replicator locking more optimistic

Basically, do all hashing in the replicator without a lock, then
lock briefly to rewrite the hashes file. Retry if someone else has
modified the hashes file in the mean time (which should be rare).

Also, a little refactoring.

Change-Id: I6257a53808d14b567bde70d2d18a9c58cb1e415a

since it's not in my sys.path, so it's clear we need to set
PYTHONPATH before running.

The whole business of running the tool from the tools/conf dir

Change-Id: I89b4d874a6ee3732234a9704a8ee6001a293ed71
"}]
commit_message:
Allow generate_sample.sh to be run from toplevel dir

I hit an issue where extract_opts.py couldn't import importutils
since it's not in my sys.path, so it's clear we need to set
PYTHONPATH before running.

The whole business of running the tool from the tools/conf dir
is fairly awkward, so change it to run from the top-level dir
instead.

Change-Id: I89b4d874a6ee3732234a9704a8ee6001a293ed71

commit_message:
Let admin list instances in vm_states.DELETED

Command 'nova list --status DELETED' returns nothing at the moment.
Make 'nova list --status DELETED' work and work for admin only.

Fixes LP Bug #1037885

Change-Id: I0bace95df713a767bb17e470e66361e1891e628c

Align watch_data_get_all with other "all" methods, and
return all watch data without requiring an ID.  We may
also need by_id and by_name variants but this is more
consistent and makes things easier for cloudwatch.

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat DB : make watch_data_get_all work with no watch ID

Align watch_data_get_all with other "all" methods, and
return all watch data without requiring an ID.  We may
also need by_id and by_name variants but this is more
consistent and makes things easier for cloudwatch.

Change-Id: I09c90278349efc769ab7c719f686a1fd854b425a
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat API : Add HeatAPINotImplementedError exception

Add heat-specific HeatAPINotImplementedError, which
allows us to return a sensible error to requests for
API actions which have not yet been implemented

EC2 image ids are allocated when the images are listed for the first
time. Remind users of this if they specify an image id which does
not exist. Resolves bug 961451.

Change-Id: Id7326ba32e58051dbbf25c3c940fd0c9cc611ff3
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a hint for missing EC2 image ids

EC2 image ids are allocated when the images are listed for the first
time. Remind users of this if they specify an image id which does
not exist. Resolves bug 961451.

Change-Id: Id7326ba32e58051dbbf25c3c940fd0c9cc611ff3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-16 18:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allows libvirt to set a serial number for a volume

The serial number defaults to the volume_id of the volume being
attached. We may expose a method in the future to set a different
serial number when creating or attaching a volume.

The purpose of this change is to give users a consistent place
they can find their volume. It should show up now in most flavors
of linux under /disk/by-id/virtio-<volume_uuid>

Fixes bug 1004328

Change-Id: Id1c56b5b23d799deb7da2d39ae57ecb48965c55f
'}]
commit_message:
Allows libvirt to set a serial number for a volume

The serial number defaults to the volume_id of the volume being
attached. We may expose a method in the future to set a different
serial number when creating or attaching a volume.

The purpose of this change is to give users a consistent place
they can find their volume. It should show up now in most flavors
of linux under /disk/by-id/virtio-<volume_uuid>

Fixes bug 1004328

Change-Id: Id1c56b5b23d799deb7da2d39ae57ecb48965c55f

commit_message:
Fix auth_token middleware to fetch revocation list as admin.

Make the revocation list into a JSON document and get the Vary header.
This will also allow the revocation list to carry additional
information in the future, to include sufficient information for the
calling application to figure out how to get the certificates it
requires.

Bug 1038309

Change-Id: I4a41cbd8a7352e5b5f951027d6f2063b169bce89

import util

commit_message:
Split functional test into standalone and utility class

This allows functional tests to be written for each individual template.
See the test_Wordpress_Single_Instance for an example, but the basic
form to follow is:

import util

def test_template():
    func_utils = util.FuncUtils()

    func_utils.create_stack(template, 'F17')
    func_utils.check_cfntools()
    func_utils.wait_for_provisioning()
    func_utils.check_user_data(template)

    ssh = func_utils.get_ssh_client()

    # test stuff here

    func_utils.cleanup()

Functional test changes:
Changed jeos creation to use new tool.
Added distribution to heat stack creation.
Improved IP parsing from glance.
Improve SSH connection exception handling.
Changed cfntools SHA check to match installed copy instead of locally.
Fixed stack parsing to check correct file and handle user-data injection.

Clean up run_tests a little to make it clear default execution is on host.
Add a short option for unit test running only (may be important due to not
wanting to run functional tests locally).

Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Split functional test into stand alone and utility class

This allows functional tests to be written for each individual template.
See the test_Wordpress_Single_Instance for an example, but the basic
form to follow is:

import util

def test_template():
    func_utils = util.FuncUtils()

    func_utils.create_stack(template, 'F17')
    func_utils.check_cfntools()
    func_utils.wait_for_provisioning()
    func_utils.check_user_data(template)

    ssh = func_utils.get_ssh_client()

    # test stuff here

    func_utils.cleanup()

Change-Id: Iadebc91d06acd61f72beeb194fc43e4f9dedfdc6
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refresh functional test to work

Some of the changes were due to the code changing over time.
Changed jeos creation to use new tool.
Added distribution to heat stack creation.
Improved IP parsing from glance.
Improve SSH connection exception handling.
Changed cfntools SHA check to match installed copy instead of locally.
Fixed stack parsing to check correct file and handle user-data injection.

Clean up run_tests a little to make it clear default execution is on host.
Add a short option for unit test running only (will be important soon).

Change-Id: Ibd1e86829fbdfa928e1894df708e8a0e477c93dc
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
change verbose and debug to Fasle in keystone.conf.sample

fix bug #1039857

verbose and debug is False by default, but they display True in
keystone.conf.sample. It may confuse people who cp
keystone.conf.sample to keystone.conf

Change-Id: I62031b879196da1633a198b6ae1f116485fe783b

commit_message:
Change underscores in new cert options to dashes

* --os_cacert -> --os-cacert
* --os_cert   -> --os-cert
* --os_key    -> --os-key

* OS_CA_CERT didn't match --os-cacert, change to OS_CACERT

Fixes bug 1040162

Change-Id: Ib03ff492b6ab2b76e54974e5436a444725615ea6

commit_message:
Run core unit tests for each plugin

Fixes bug 1040277

Execute the test cases in test_db_plugin.py for each plugin.
Each plugin now get its own test_<plugin_name>_plugin test module.
This commit excludes cisco and metaplugin plugins, which do not run
the "core" unit tests at all.

Change-Id: I137411f47d8cfcc753aa3a88359f5b1590ca8237

commit_message:
monkey_patch all eventlet modules

We were only monkey-patching the socket module. This
changes the call to monkey-patch ALL of the available
modules.

Fixes bug 988099.

Change-Id: I1014a7416d16bbf5008edd65d9bf2246bf277658

Hey Alan,

Would it be better to throw an explicit exception that the sysadmin could see and respond too (i.e. "missing configuration...")?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-31 19:59:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Doc update if this goes through: https://review.openstack.org/11691'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-08-21 09:30:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Alan, could you also make changes to etc/nova/api-paste.ini and etc/nova/nova.conf.sample?

Note that this change is in _keystone_ project not nova, and coordinated changes across projects in feature-freeze are probably no-go.
This would also require a coordinated change in devstack too, so I wouldn't do such changes before Grizzly opens.

> If this gets in, is it going into Folsom or Grizzly?

Since this change maintains backward compatiblity it is safe for Folsom, but I would not change default sample configs in Nova or Glance before Grizzly.

Distributions are of course free to modify their default config files so they could use this change."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-08-21 19:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
allow middleware configuration from app config

From markmc's proposal:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-July/000277.html

For backward compatiblity, configuration from paste-deploy INI is used
if it exists. If not, section [keystone_authtoken] in  global
configuration is expected, with the same parameter names.

Requires application using global cfg.CONF object (nova and glance since
folsom-2) and before there's openstack.common library, attempts to use
copy/pasted <application>.openstack.common.cfg

DocImpact

Change-Id: If6aa22280f4ce2cc698d99a130b5792dab808363

(2 inline comments)

two minor comments, maybe worth addressing if you have to update the patch for other reasons, otherwise not. 

thanks for finishing this up for me :)'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi dean,

Is there an official plan to do this across all openstack projects?  If so, when?  I personally don't have an opinion on the merits of dashes vs. underscores.  The Quantum CLI policy for Folsom was to mirror what seemed to be the behavior of Nova, which was to use dashes for command names, and underscores for options.  Its definitely too late in the game to switch all of the quantum commands, and I don't think making some quantum CLI commands inconsistent with others in the same CLI with the idea that we'll update the others later makes sense.  In my opinion, changes like this need to be decided on community wide at a design summit, communicated widely, and then acted on early in a release cycle."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I'd like to make a plea to use '-' as the option word separator rather than '_' in all new options and as many of the existing ones as you can get away with now.  I'm (slowly) working on patches for all of the CLIs to do this, leaving the '_' options in place as deprecated and not visible in the help output."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

merge'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

reverify'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi dan, If you have no time, I can help with the test codes.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

If we need to change - and _, we have to use another change to do it. So I think we can make this change get in.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 12:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
initial client + CLI support for routers + floating ips

bp quantum-client-l3-floating-ip

The task also does the following:
1. Fixes alignment of the --help output
2. Ensures that a show command prints a dictionary correctly

Change-Id: Ib61b3e8748a7bd476ec008ab6ce20ab852e92f58

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Change-Id: I378954997a5d893ac1156c2ae254532c617f78c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-23 00:29:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception handling in libvirt attach_volume()

Currently, the real reason for a failure is dropped when attempting
to unroll the volume connection (with the exception of when it is
VIR_ERR_OPERATION_FAILED). This change uses save_and_reraise_exception()
to correct that so that the actual reason for failure gets logged.

Fixes bug 1029463

Change-Id: Id47db565c4fb5a88d1a263600b41706dd3419726
Signed-off-by: Aaron Rosen <arosen@nicira.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception handling in libvirt attach_volume()

Currently, the real reason for a failure is dropped when attempting
to unroll the volume connection (with the exception of when it is
VIR_ERR_OPERATION_FAILED). This change uses save_and_reraise_exception()
to correct that so that the actual reason for failure gets logged.

Fixes bug 1029463

Change-Id: Id47db565c4fb5a88d1a263600b41706dd3419726
Signed-off-by: Aaron Rosen <arosen@nicira.com>

subject: Implement signed messages in ZeroMQ driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know there could be value in having this for other rpc mechanisms. We'd need to look at either implementing this per-driver or abstracting it higher in the RPC abstraction.

Also, the SSL module might be worthwhile to keep inside of the rpc directory, and possibly renaming (at least the flags).

Looking for thoughts and feedback."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Quick question: the code seems relatively simple. Are there major architectural blockers to adding this to rabbit and qpid as well?

Vish'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

or even adding it to rpc instead of in the driver?'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (5 inline comments)

<quote>
We *could* do verification in RpcDispatcher, but it just seems wrong.</quote>

While call/cast goes there, message replies don't go to RpcDispatcher (necessarily).  The ZeroMQ driver now bypasses the dispatcher/process entirely for replies... it opens the envelopes and uses IPC to get the replies to the blocked call()."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Vish, we could do the signing relatively easily from the abstraction. However, one of the biggest problems is that message consumption is handled entirely by the drivers. Even if we considered putting this into the RpcDispatcher, we'd need to independently address this for message replies which are currently handled entirely in-driver.

One solution would be to have signatures created in the abstraction and to let the individual drivers optionally handle verification.

I suspect adding the verification code to independent drivers wouldn't be terribly difficult.

If signing is done higher-up, we'll have to change the message envelopes. Currently, the RPC mechanisms serialize and pass the dictionary as provided by the user. With signing, this would have to become something like:
  json.dumps([ json.dumps([ dict, time.time() ]), str(signature) ])

The double JSON encoding would be necessary since the signature would be applied to the JSON'ed dict+timestamp. Handling this per-driver can potentially avoid this; The ZeroMQ driver would pass the signature as a separate part of a multi-part message, rather than double-JSON'ing."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Double posting because Gerrit thought I was writing Python, when I wasn't:
--------------------

Vish, we could do the signing relatively easily from the abstraction. 

However, one of the biggest problems is that message consumption is handled entirely by the drivers. Even if we considered putting this into the RpcDispatcher, we'd need to independently address this for message replies which are currently handled entirely in-driver.

One solution would be to have signatures created in the abstraction and to let the individual drivers optionally handle verification.
I suspect adding the verification code to independent drivers wouldn't be terribly difficult.

_If signing is done higher-up, we'll have to change the message envelopes. Currently, the RPC mechanisms serialize and pass the dictionary as provided by the user. With signing, this would have to become something like...

  json.dumps([ json.dumps([ dict, time.time() ]), str(signature) ])

The double JSON encoding would be necessary since the signature would be applied to the JSON'ed dict+timestamp. Handling this per-driver can potentially avoid this; The ZeroMQ driver would pass the signature as a separate part of a multi-part message, rather than double-JSON'ing."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Now uses pycrypto. Changed the verification failure message.

Russell: are you sure about just rpc.amqp.ProxyCallback.__call__? We should be checking signatures on message replies too. I suppose this verification would go into MulticallWaiter.

That also doesn't address the sending side... which seems to be a bit less abstracted in the AMQP code, but as you said, it might be good to have this in the drivers rather than in amqp.py (or higher)"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Russell, sorry, this was supposed to remain in draft status for architectural review- rather than functional acknowledgement.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

FYI - the next patch will rename common.ssl to common.crypto.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

This is still a WIP'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Russell, also, yes... I do have some updates to this. You did point out a few things that I hadn't yet fixed, and a few I hadn't yet noticed. I'll update. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm thinking that with F3 ending soon, it would be nice to get this in - even if only into the ZeroMQ driver. Unlike RabbitMQ and Qpid, we don't have SSL (or SASL)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/490/consoleFull : SUCCESS

Throwing this out there, in case Russell wants to do anything in Kombu/Qpid.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (5 inline comments)

Nice work, Eric.

I left some minor code comments, but I'll cover the bigger things here.

1) Can you take a look at pycrypto and see if we can use that instead of pyopenssl?  I just say that since pycrypto is already a dependency of nova.  Minimizing dependency additions would be good when practical to do so.

2) I'd like to work with you on getting this to work with kombu and qpid.  I like that this wasn't hugely invasive to impl_zmq, so I think we can do it without too much trouble.

I think both the original message dict and the signature should be passed into the drivers as separate bits of data.  Message serialization is already a per-driver thing and I think it makes sense to leave it that way.

For the message signature verification, I'm not seeing an obvious way to do it in only one place right now.  I agree with you that we can just make this per-driver.  In reality that means the code will just be in 2 places.  For qpid/kombu, it would probably go in rpc.amqp.ProxyCallback.__call__, as that is where the message data is getting unpacked and it makes sense to do the verification as early as possible.

We *could* do verification in RpcDispatcher, but it just seems wrong.  It feels like the verification should be done before that, and the dispatcher's job should be only to dispatch.  :-)"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ah yes, you're right about the replies.  I'll take a closer look ..."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm planning to work on this asap this week to help get it to support all of the drivers and merged by F3.  I don't think it will be too much work."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Do you have another version of this patch that you have been testing?  I just got a bit concerned when I saw that the unit tests can't run, and impl_zmq can't load in this patch."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Abandoned

commit_message:
Implement signed messages in ZeroMQ driver

Introduces common crypto library,
pycrypto is now required by openstack-common.

Adds rpc_zmq_signing.

Add crypto-key generator tool.

This partially implements blueprint trusted-messaging

Change-Id: Ia50471e39c32f450bdcf0ca5f03a457c412cbedb

Waiting on the patch for master to merge, which is waiting on a tempest change.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-24 19:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ok, I'm inclined to think this isn't a "high impact bug" and isn't worth a relatively invasive change like this. This is obviously something a user can easily work around. Also the fact that we'd need to get the stable/essex branch of tempest updated makes me wary.

For reference, the policy I'm trying to apply here: http://wiki.openstack.org/StableBranch#Appropriate_Fixes

Feel free to comment if you think I've underestimated the impact of the bug.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-25 09:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the review, mark.

Well, my view on the impact is that its a positive thing in this case, as it exposes a previously unknown failure to clients.

So any client that is broken by receiving this error would previously also have been broken by the attempted password change having no effect.

Now, if best-effort semantics actually made sense the action involved, then reporting a previously "swallowed" exception would, I agree, be too disruptive for a stable branch change.

However in this case, I don't think a sensible client would ever want to just take their best shot at changing the root password - instead it would need to know the outcome definitively one way or the other. So my thought was that only already broken/incomplete clients would be impacted negatively by the change.

Just my $0.02 ...

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-25 09:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Right, my point isn't about API compatibility.

Any change involves a risk of introducing a regression. A big part of what we're trying to do with the stable branch is keep the number and size of changes small so as to reduce the risk of regression. Hence the need to weigh up risk versus user-visible benefit for each change.

The user-visible benefit here is that users who attempt to use the changePassword API on clouds which don't use the xenapi driver will get a NotImplemented error. This doesn't seem like a huge benefit to me - the cloud operator can easily document that it doesn't work on their cloud. What an operator would value more would be a way to completely disable the API, I suspect.

How about the risk? You've changed the checks_instance_lock decorator which carries the (small) potential of breaking an awful lot of stuff. You've made a bunch of changes to set_admin_password() itself which carries the risk of breaking working xenapi based deployments.

So, I'm still concluding "not worth it" on the risk vs benefit thing.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-30 14:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-30 14:20:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Mark

OK, so I've de-scoped the change in line with master, so that the @checks_instance_lock is left unchanged and the return value from nova.compute.manager.set_admin_password() is now gone.

So the substantive changes are now just changing the RPC MEP and modifying the exception-handling logic in nova.compute.manager.set_admin_password() to raise InstancePasswordSetFailed.

Does that de-scoping impact on your risk assessment any?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-30 14:25:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

commit_message:
Setting root passwd no longer fails silently.

Fixes LP 1022961

Previously an attempt to set the root password would fail silently if
for example the driver did not support this action.

To avoid the user being misled that the password change had succeeded,
we now report any failure by changing the MEP for set_admin_password
RPC from cast to call.

Change-Id: I1fd7b925e9226d30892f3a7cc4ddb938ff678a55

Thanks for the testing gary.  

I will try and use aaron's setup to reproduce this.

I actually intentionally removed admin privileges from the user in this commit, as the 'nova' client doesn't properly handle security groups if the user has admin privileges (it assumes each client will only see a single security group with a given name, but security group names are actually only unique per-tenant).  

Looks like Fedora installs 'nova' to a different location.  I'm not sure why the original authors of the script wanted to hardcode the path, rather than relying on nova being in path.  Shouldn't stack.sh always result in 'nova' being in path?"}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-08-04 06:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2012-06-09 02:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Cleaned up the code and added the keystone auth stuff that seemed to be broken.

Change-Id: If04ca7854fedf485db8de31c5b18264056dad2af
'}, {'created': '2012-07-20 17:57:36.000000000', 'message': 'Improvements to quantum.sh exercise script

Many small fixes to the quantum.sh script to make it work reliably
and with the latest versions of various clients.

Note: these changes are still using Quantum v1, as v2 does not yet
fully support this test.

Updates include:
- adding a delay between booting VMs (usely on double-virt systems)
- using nova-manage, not mysql access to get network-ids.
- using 'source openrc' to set correct credentials for each operation
- add "fast exit" checks to see when servers become active, rather than
a static pause.
- changed IP prefix values to be less likely to collide with other
networks used for testing.
- poke security group holes to allow pings.
- add pause between killing VMs and deleting networks to avoid race
where network tear-down fails b/c there are still ports on the network.
- change behavior of script with no arguments to run all tests (rather
than requiring -a)
- add flags to selectively run tear-down portions of the script.  Useful
for incremental testing/debugging.

Change-Id: If04ca7854fedf485db8de31c5b18264056dad2af
'}, {'created': '2012-07-23 04:24:40.000000000', 'message': 'Improvements to quantum.sh exercise script

- using 'source openrc' to set correct credentials for each operation
- add "fast exit" checks to see when servers become active, rather than
a static pause.
- changed IP prefix values to be less likely to collide with other
networks used for testing.
- poke security group holes to allow pings.
- add pause between killing VMs and deleting networks to avoid race
where network tear-down fails b/c there are still ports on the network.
- change behavior of script with no arguments to run all tests (rather
than requiring -a)
- add flags to selectively run tear-down portions of the script.  Useful
for incremental testing/debugging.
- change --flagfile to --config-file for nova-manage
- remove admin role from test tenants demo1 and demo2 (this was braking
an attempt to add the security group, as novaclient assumes security
group names are unique per query, which is not true for admin users).

Change-Id: If04ca7854fedf485db8de31c5b18264056dad2af
'}, {'created': '2012-07-24 20:02:52.000000000', 'message': 'Improvements to quantum.sh exercise script

commit_message:
Improvements to quantum.sh exercise script

Many small fixes to the quantum.sh script to make it work reliably
and with the latest versions of various clients.

Note: these changes are still using Quantum v1, as v2 does not yet
fully support this test.

Updates include:
- adding a delay between booting VMs (usely on double-virt systems)
- using nova-manage, not mysql access to get network-ids.
- using 'source openrc' to set correct credentials for each operation
- add "fast exit" checks to see when servers become active, rather than
a static pause.
- changed IP prefix values to be less likely to collide with other
networks used for testing.
- poke security group holes to allow pings.
- add pause between killing VMs and deleting networks to avoid race
where network tear-down fails b/c there are still ports on the network.
- change behavior of script with no arguments to run all tests (rather
than requiring -a)
- add flags to selectively run tear-down portions of the script.  Useful
for incremental testing/debugging.
- change --flagfile to --config-file for nova-manage
- remove admin role from test tenants demo1 and demo2 (this was braking
an attempt to add the security group, as novaclient assumes security
group names are unique per query, which is not true for admin users).

Change-Id: If04ca7854fedf485db8de31c5b18264056dad2af

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-07-25 19:17:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I notice a lot of timeout values are used by just sleeping for that amount of time.  I believe devstack and exercises usually set larger timeouts, and then perform repeated actions to determine when a condition is met.  In other words, instead of doing:

  sleep 15
  # assume server is destroyed

It does:

  until 120 second timeout is reached:
    if server is destroyed: break
    sleep 1

Which makes it more resilient in case the tests are running on a slow machine.  Since we run the devstack-gate on VMs that can be very slow at times, I worry about whether just sleeping and then assuming an action is complete is resilient enough -- perhaps the exercises should adopt the busy-wait approach with longer timeouts.

(Also, if you sleep 15 seconds but you only needed to wait 2, it's just wasting time.)"}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-07-26 07:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2012-07-26 07:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-26 07:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-07-26 15:53:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-01 10:17:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (2 inline comments)

one question inline.  

also note: this patch is very similar to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/8369/

Do you think we should merge your patch first, then rework this other patch, or merge the two patches up front?  

Also, once mark's changes to support overlapping IPs for DHCP are available, you won't automatically be ping VMs directly from the test host as is, since the device with the DHCP IP will be in another network namespace.  We need to figure out how to handle this.  One option would be to have the test script actually create a fake ports that it can use itself (this is pretty easy at least with open vswitch)."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-08 23:36:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

commit_message:
repair the bug about why the exercise.sh scripts have failures when Quantum is enabled

bug 1014187

ensure that devstack exercise scripts are ok when quantum is enabled.

Patch Set 3: upgrade quantum api from v1 to v2

Patch Set 4: change sleep to "until 120 second timeout is reached"

Patch Set 5: remove trailing space at the end of line

Change-Id: Ie81eda568a7524a64bfb32a70f2cbbaaf13a8a10

Change-Id: I0aa6fb9a29f6e851eb2621d70d400e1505ae2d32
'}, {'created': '2012-08-23 05:37:52.000000000', 'message': 'Regarding the mispelling of the Noble Narwhal.

The narwhal, or narwhale, Monodon monoceros, is a medium-sized toothed whale
that lives year-round in the Arctic. One of two living species of whale in
the Monodontidae family, along with the beluga whale, narwhal males are
distinguished by a long, straight, helical tusk, actually an elongated upper
left canine. Found primarily in Canadian Arctic and Greenlandic waters,
rarely south of 65°N latitude, the narwhal is a uniquely specialized Arctic
predator. In the winter, it feeds on benthic prey, mostly flatfish, at
depths of up to 1500 m under dense pack ice.  Narwhals have been harvested
for over a thousand years by Inuit people in northern Canada and Greenland
for meat and ivory, and a regulated subsistence hunt continues to this day.
While populations appear stable, the narwhal has been deemed particularly
vulnerable to climate change due to a narrow geographical range and
specialized diet.

Via Wikipedia

Change-Id: I0aa6fb9a29f6e851eb2621d70d400e1505ae2d32
'}]
commit_message:
Regarding the mispelling of the Noble Narwhal.

The narwhal, or narwhale, Monodon monoceros, is a medium-sized toothed whale
that lives year-round in the Arctic. One of two living species of whale in
the Monodontidae family, along with the beluga whale, narwhal males are
distinguished by a long, straight, helical tusk, actually an elongated upper
left canine. Found primarily in Canadian Arctic and Greenlandic waters,
rarely south of 65°N latitude, the narwhal is a uniquely specialized Arctic
predator. In the winter, it feeds on benthic prey, mostly flatfish, at
depths of up to 1500 m under dense pack ice.  Narwhals have been harvested
for over a thousand years by Inuit people in northern Canada and Greenland
for meat and ivory, and a regulated subsistence hunt continues to this day.
While populations appear stable, the narwhal has been deemed particularly
vulnerable to climate change due to a narrow geographical range and
specialized diet.

Via Wikipedia

Change-Id: I0aa6fb9a29f6e851eb2621d70d400e1505ae2d32

commit_message:
add availability_zone to openstack metadata

This adds the key 'availability_zone' to the metadata for openstack.

'availability-zone' in EC2 is very useful to the instance to figure out
where it is.  For example, Ubuntu uses this information to determine
mirror location on EC2.

Fixes bug 1039579.

Change-Id: I212d3854b75e08a67138b5cd0bea178c47840e11

commit_message:
Adds support for serial to libvirt config disks.

In order for users to find a volume that they have attached to
a vm, it is valuable to be able to find it in a consistent
location. A following patch wil accomplish this by setting
the serial number of the device to the uuid of the volume.

This patch prepares for that change by allowing serial numbers
to be set in the libvirt config disk object.

Prepares to fix bug 1004328

Change-Id: Iecdfc17b45e1c38df50f844f127c0e95558ab22c

commit_message:
Re-define libvirt domain on "not found" exception

Fixes bug 1039891

If for any reason a libvirt-based VM becomes unregistered, there is
currently no mechanism for recovering without administrative
intervention. Discussing this with Vish, we agreed it was prudent to
validate and accordingly define domains with libvirt on hard_reboot or
hypervisor reboot.

This patch will allow hard_reboot to re-define a domain in the event
that a "domain not found" exception is returned from libvirt.  The
same approach is also applied to resume_state_on_host_boot.

Change-Id: Ic0cd59087d3d84787173fdd9eefdb77b67c33995

commit_message:
OVS plugin tunnel bridges never learn

This patch installs a flow_mod to handle each vm
with the normal action which allows OVS to do mac learning.
Fixes bug 1011467

Change-Id: Ib6500813d4111ae42675459fac64dfb2e9c40d91

commit_message:
Clarifying swift memcache configuration docs

fixes bug 994338

There was previously no reference to the fact that memcache_servers
could be in a separate config file, and the filter:cache section
of configuration options was missing from the proxy config section

Patchset 2 indicates what changed in the bk (book) file in the
revision history table.

Change-Id: I07b9d5e4b5ee0eca867e4bc645728ab637c8d5b6

messages:
[{'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-08-22 18:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The patch looks good thanks.
Though there are some meta issues.

1. You set yourself as the author.
Really you should just --amend --author="Dan Smith<danms@us.ibm.com>"

2. You created a new bug.
Probably you should just have clicked "nominate for series"
on the existing bug.
(he also needs to be added to the Authors file).

3. You used a separate Change-Id.
It's OK, and in fact preferred to use the
same gerrit ID on different branches
to ease tracking of changes.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-22 18:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Hi p-draigbrady, 

>The patch looks good thanks. Though there are some meta issues.
>1. You set yourself as the author. Really you should just --amend --author="Dan Smith<danms@us.ibm.com>"

Sure, I can do this though there is one minor change between his patch and this one: 
-with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception():
+with utils.save_and_reraise_exception():
I'll revise this patch also adding him to the Authors file. Let me know if I should also --amend --author. 

>2. You created a new bug. Probably you should just have clicked "nominate for series" on the existing bug. (he also needs to be added to the 
>Authors file).
Thanks, next time I'll do that. Added. 
>3. You used a separate Change-Id. It's OK, and in fact preferred to use the same gerrit ID on different branches to ease tracking of changes.
Okay.

Thanks, 

Aaron'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2012-08-22 19:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-22 19:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-08-22 23:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please only add primary author to Authors.
You could --amend --author="Dan" and add
a 'Signed-off-by: you' to the commit message.
That's the standard way to indication multiple
authorship in git.

Also you should probably just say:
Fixes bug: 1029463
and independently close 1040207 as invalid

Also you should copy Change-Id: from Dan's commit as previously mentioned.

Here is a similar change I did for reference:
I740c0def3b1f759aec3d4ae5fe3264484c704807

commit_message:
Fix exception handling in libvirt attach_volume()

Currently, the real reason for a failure is dropped when attempting
to unroll the volume connection (with the exception of when it is
VIR_ERR_OPERATION_FAILED). This change uses save_and_reraise_exception()
to correct that so that the actual reason for failure gets logged.

Fixes bug 1029463

Change-Id: Ie59ec2ac365e58ca8b7ec60d95452363f97d2ff7
Signed-off-by: Aaron Rosen <arosen@nicira.com>

commit_message:
xenapi: Support live migration without pools

Implement blueprint xenapi-live-block-migration.
Add ability to live migrate VMs to hosts that are not
a part of a host aggregate (block migration).

This requires XenServer 6.1/later, or XCP 1.6/later. As
of this change, we still do not support instances with
(nova/cinder) volumes attached. External kernels are also
not supported.

Change-Id: I5feb6756d78804aa37780a7d0cda1600f7060afe

commit_message:
Document the use of keyring.

* README.rst
  Document the option --os-use-keyring, and environment variable
  OS_USE_KEYRING, to enable keyring.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-22 14:34:05.000000000', 'message': "Clarify nwfilter not found error message

In bug #1039398 the user got an error message about an instance's
nwfilter not being found, but it gave the impression that live
migration was involved.

The ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance() method was originally
just used for live migration, but since:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~chemikadze/nova/driver-agnostic-restart-instances/+merge/69069

it has also been used when re-starting the compute service when
there are running VMs.

Clarify the error message and the comments in the code to reflect
this.

Waiting up to 30 seconds before reporting an error here seems
pretty bad. It appears this is to handle the case where the
nwfilters get defined in a separate thread. For reference, the
code was added by this merge:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~nttdata/nova/live-migration/+merge/44940

For now, just add a comment explaining why we're polling for
the existence of the nwfilter.

Change-Id: Ieb085a6753ac72116d5f5a706fd1a908703286ad
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify nwfilter not found error message

In bug #1039398 the user got an error message about an instance's
nwfilter not being found, but it gave the impression that live
migration was involved.

The ensure_filtering_rules_for_instance() method was originally
just used for live migration, but since:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~chemikadze/nova/driver-agnostic-restart-instances/+merge/69069

it has also been used when re-starting the compute service when
there are running VMs.

Clarify the error message and the comments in the code to reflect
this.

Waiting up to 30 seconds before reporting an error here seems
pretty bad. It appears this is to handle the case where the
nwfilters get defined in a separate thread. For reference, the
code was added by this merge:

  https://code.launchpad.net/~nttdata/nova/live-migration/+merge/44940

For now, just add a comment explaining why we're polling for
the existence of the nwfilter.

Change-Id: Ieb085a6753ac72116d5f5a706fd1a908703286ad

commit_message:
Restore imagebackend in test_virt_drivers.py

In the test, nova.virt.libvirt.driver.imagebackend is replaced with
fake_imagebackend at setUp(). But is not restored at tearDown(). It
potentially causes failure in other tests expecting imagebackend is
unchanged. Example: test_libvirt.py:test_pre_block_migration_works_correctly.
However it runs without failure since luckily it comes before
test_virt_drivers.py.

Change-Id: I9b61c6c065567472b64bfa363af8f3ba9a502dd2

commit_message:
Don't show user-data when its not sent.

Don't show user-data in the instance metadata service
if the instance was not started with any user-data.

LP: #1035317

Change-Id: Idf9b263a39f3b8d75aaf3e6d1debbe283cf9ff64
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

know when the replicator is removing objects.  This was previously
handled for the object-replicator
(object-replicator.partition.delete.count.<device> and
object-replicator.partition.update.count.<device> metrics) but not the
account and container replicators.

This patch extends the existing DB removal count metrics to make them

Change-Id: I2067317d4a5f8ad2a496834147954bdcdfc541c1

commit_message:
Add device name to *-replicator.removes for DBs

To tell when replication for a device has finished, it's important to
know when the replicator is removing objects.  This was previously
handled for the object-replicator
(object-replicator.partition.delete.count.<device> and
object-replicator.partition.update.count.<device> metrics) but not the
account and container replicators.

This patch extends the existing DB removal count metrics to make them
per-device.  The new metrics are:
 account-replicator.removes.<device>
 container-replicator.removes.<device>

There's also a bonus refactoring and increased test coverage of the DB
replicator code.

Change-Id: I2067317d4a5f8ad2a496834147954bdcdfc541c1

commit_message:
Add nosehtmloutput as a test dependency.

Adding nosehtmloutput as a test dependency allows nose to output its
results to an html file. This will be used by Jenkins to save logs on
a different server.

Make slight modification to run_tests.sh in order to output the nose
test results to two different html files. One for Horizon and one for
the dashboard.

Change-Id: Ic1ed086b24705d0f2bca07f8e921646532e46c3b

What about existing vdi's that don't have the tag?  On my devsetup they just change from 'managed ( RO): true' to 'managed ( RO): false' presumably because the vdi.destroy command gets issued and xen realizes it can't destroy a vdi on a 'type ( RO): iscsi' sr.

Can you please elaborate on the expected SM behavior for iscsi sr's?  Perhaps I'm assuming that the backing sr for those vdi's is expected to be lvmoiscsi instead of just iscsi (like os-volumes), because otherwise that vdi-destroy isn't expected to work anyway?

Regardless, in the case where we are terminating an instance with os-volumes attached - we *really* need to unplug the pbd to terminate the connection to the storage node and clean up the sr (as is done in volumeops.detach_volume, similar to what happens in virt.driver.libvirt.driver._cleanup, where it calls virt.driver.libvirt.volume.disconnect_volume)."}, {'account_id': 2535, 'date': '2012-08-06 20:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-06 20:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work
