'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-08 16:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think the column is too long:

maybe tenant_deleted.

I also think that instances with this flag should not be shown in the instance list either.  Probably compute.get_all should filter based on this item unless the user is an admin."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-08 16:55:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

also, I don't think that _delete_instance is safe to be called multiple times, so the cleanup code probably needs to be updated as well."}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2012-08-08 17:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm confused by what you're trying to add here with the new flag.

Isn't it enough to just change the gating function on delete to allow it regardless of vm_state and task_state and then let the delete code work its normal magic ?

That would set the task state to "Deleting", at which point nothing apart from another delete request should be allowed, and the value of the task_state can be used to exclude it from Billing (this logic belongs outside of Nova - passing the task_state in the usage data is all Nova should do)  

It seems that by adding the "vm_tenant_expect_deleted" flag you're adding another path (via a period task) to trigger the delete - whereas if the compute manager is running it will process the request, and if it isn't running the period task won't run either.  Checking for a task_state of "deleting" on compute manager start_up and re-starting the delete would seem claner.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-08 18:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Phil: good point. We could even exclude instances with the task state deleting from the instance list by default.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-13 15:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Vish/Phil: at the moment, the "gate" already allow delete API on any vm/task state combination, and prevent other tasks being admitted. However the problem is that if another task is in the middle of execution, the delete task will forcefully go ahead which may create race condition, and could possibly leak resources (e.g. floating ip)

Assuming there is no task preemption possible, I think the plan was to 1) somehow allow the vm to be marked as deleted in any situation for billing; 2) execute the real delete task when it's possible (i.e. no other pending tasks)
So this has to be triggered periodically.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-13 16:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yun: That makes sense, but it seems like this patch is missing quite a bit to do that safely.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-21 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-08-21 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Deletes vm in any state

As commit 129b87e17d3333aeaa9e855a70dea51e6581ea63 says now we
allow delete to be called no matter what vm_state says.

Add a flag to show that whether tenant wants to delete the insatnce.
If the flag is set we should never bill.
Add a peridic task to make sure the instance which the above
flag is set is going to be deleted.

Implements blueprint delete-in-any-state.

Change-Id: I1038c3149395a26f35235a91c841fda041e697cc

Give a way to save why a service has been disabled.

Implements blueprint service-disable-reason

This change add a short field to the service table so that a reason can be provided when disabling a service.

commit_message:
Return HTTP 422 on bad server update PUT request.

This patch updates the /servers API and the disk config
extension so that they properly handle incorrectly formatted
server update/PUT requests.

Includes a new test cause that verifies (with extensions enabled)
that a poorly formatted PUT request to /servers returns HTTP 422
instead of a 500.

Also updated the previous test_create_missing_server test to use
test.TestException instead of Exception.

Fixes LP Bug #1038227.

Change-Id: I6b11602790778465348647bb5825b7326d50065a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 22:19:44.000000000', 'message': 'Makes sure deletion works with deleted data

Commit 5ad1dea4 added changed the network deallocation code to
work with deleted instances. This was done by setting the context
to read deleted records. Unfortunately this was done a little too
broadly, leading to a new bug where a deleted floating_ip will
cause an instance to not be able to be deleted.

This fixes the issue by limiting the use of read_deleted context
to only the places it is trying to access the instance record. It
adds a test  to verify that the code works with a duplicate
deleted floating_ip and updates the existing test for a deleted
instance to exercise the entire code path.

Fixes bug 1038266

Change-Id: I1aef94369e5bcf951e78e89b1eded5305cf36b53

commit_message:
Makes sure instance deletion ok with deleted data

Commit 5ad1dea4 added changed the network deallocation code to
work with deleted instances. This was done by setting the context
to read deleted records. Unfortunately this was done a little too
broadly, leading to a new bug where a deleted floating_ip will
cause an instance to not be able to be deleted.

This fixes the issue by limiting the use of read_deleted context
to only the places it is trying to access the instance record. It
adds a test  to verify that the code works with a duplicate
deleted floating_ip and updates the existing test for a deleted
instance to exercise the entire code path.

Fixes bug 1038266

Change-Id: I1aef94369e5bcf951e78e89b1eded5305cf36b53

This was something we identified when c6be78deb6a3a7cbf092efdfb54f561ce689605f
caused some regressions which prohibited the Nova metadata server from making

Change-Id: I88d0f5a4dc263bf66f316a4d26c734b6bc9dad21

commit_message:
Allow network to call get_fixed_ip_by_address.

Updates the default Nova policy.json so that the network
API can call get_fixed_ip_by_address.

This was something we identified when c6be78deb6a3a7cbf092efdfb54f561ce689605f
caused some regressions which prohibited the Nova metadata server from making
this call. We have subsequently fixed the metadata server by correcting
admin context access to this function.... however using an explicit policy rule
(and not relying on the default) seems like a good idea as well.

Partial fix for LP Bug #1039093.

Change-Id: I88d0f5a4dc263bf66f316a4d26c734b6bc9dad21

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-20 20:05:33.000000000', 'message': "Add key_name attribute in XML servers API

Fixes bug 1039139

The API was ignoring the 'key_name' attribute and so it was impossible to
create a server associated with a keypair. This patch fix the issue.

Change-Id: I1efe542081382f3a19b31c09ddfc93929b1485d0
"}]
commit_message:
Add key_name attribute in XML servers API

Fixes bug 1039139

The API was ignoring the 'key_name' attribute and so it was impossible to
create a server associated with a keypair. This patch fix the issue.

commit_message:
Get OVS port details from port ID

Fixes bug 1037443

This address the issue when a Quantum interface does not start with the
prefix "tap" (for example interfaces created by the l3 agent)

Change-Id: Ie2c98940d921606906015914ce6b23d3095e91f2

subject: Take 3: fix https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1037815 Update rootwrap mechanism to track changes in nova/cinder Break out into per-agent filter files remove spurious whitespace reorder includes per garyk remove blank line per garyk review whitespace per garyk break out into per-agent filters per ttx back off on test_rootwrap; make it mimic nova. Don't try to execute anything, just test infrastructure

commit_message:
Take 3: fix https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1037815
Update rootwrap mechanism to track changes in nova/cinder
Break out into per-agent filter files
remove spurious whitespace
reorder includes per garyk
remove blank line per garyk review
whitespace per garyk
break out into per-agent filters per ttx
back off on test_rootwrap; make it mimic nova. Don't try to execute anything, just test infrastructure

Change-Id: If93bb4678d8365658bbafc7f57643550184a9dc9

commit_message:
Fix is_admin check via policy

When we create an admin context internally, we need to make sure
that all of the policy actions that are available to that context
are still available. This wasn't working in some cases because
we were looking for a hard-coded role called 'admin'.

Fixes bug 1039093

Change-Id: I939f834a63c9e6e6e7c87b115bd469466da66a69

commit_message:
Make max image size upload configurable

Add conf option image_size_cap to represent what the internal
IMAGE_SIZE_CAP constant used to cover in the v1 API. The default
is reduced to 1 TB from 50 PB.

Thoroughly test this on image create and update through the v1 API.

Fixes bug 1038994

Change-Id: Ie0985b62228f8b28c005a8847049d7b68d9b959a

The glance-cache-manage binary now supports the same auth env
variables and flags as python-glanceclient. The old flag formats

Change-Id: If9f15d030e3167f5c81ea275c0005c854cd94a40
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth cred opts for glance-cache-manage

The glance-cache-manage binary now supports the same auth env
variables and flags as python-glanceclient. The old flag formats
are still supported (but not documented) to support backwards-
compatibility.

Fixes bug 1038112

Change-Id: If9f15d030e3167f5c81ea275c0005c854cd94a40

If that fails it'll show up in the tests as ERROR instead of FAIL, when we know that for whatever Exception is being thrown is the expected failure case.


A better solution would be to wrap the calls with:

try:
   ... elided ...
except WhateverExceptionIsThrown:
   self.fail("A nice clean failure message")

Usage of logging seems to be limited to the check_for_export() tests and

check whether an exception was raised.

"}]
commit_message:
Remove logging in volume tests

Fixes bug #932137

Usage of logging seems to be limited to the check_for_export() tests and
should be to cleanup. check_for_export() raises an exception if there's
a problem and it does nothing if it succeeds. The tests should just
check whether an exception was raised.

Change-Id: I72bc3d97aa75950c7f31fae03535c541059501c2

[{'created': '2012-08-19 02:26:55.000000000', 'message': "doc swift service start issues with no ring

fixes bug 996944

As in the bug report, users following this guide exactly
will encounter a failed service start at this point in the
manual. This isn't a big problem - the ring files just need to be
copied first.

Rather than significantly changing the flow of the docs, this change
adds a simple warning so that first-time users aren't alarmed.

Change-Id: Ibaff34a14e7d82f674b6fe9b47923f7465d8825b
"}]
commit_message:
doc swift service start issues with no ring

fixes bug 996944

As in the bug report, users following this guide exactly
will encounter a failed service start at this point in the
manual. This isn't a big problem - the ring files just need to be
copied first.

Rather than significantly changing the flow of the docs, this change
adds a simple warning so that first-time users aren't alarmed.

Change-Id: Ibaff34a14e7d82f674b6fe9b47923f7465d8825b

subject: Slight fleshing of nova-manage doc
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-04 13:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I agree we need more docs around nova-manage, at least for essex. One comment inline.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-06-04 20:42:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Okay, some more background. That doc bug is quite old, and there are no nova-manage image commands in Essex. But, certainly encouraging people to read the man page is in order. More comments inline. 

When updating the docs for Essex I even removed the deprecated_auth info (which is where you'd use nova-manage account create and that sort of thing) since it was soooo confusing to people and they would send me really angry emails. :)

So while background is good, happy path is better in this case. If we can just encourage reading the man page, we'll probably be okay."}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-06-11 09:28:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Since the installation provides the nova (client) bin. for managing the cloud on a daily basis (so the images) maybe we could use that as an entry point 
- nova-manage : for configuring and setup the cloud
- nova : for managing it on a daily basis"}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-06-18 08:01:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok - so here's the plan:

1) Abandon this change, and submit it to stable/Essex.
2) run through the entire docs with Folsom in mind to replace nova-manage with nova

thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-06-18 09:44:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think even in folsom, you still need both commands. 
I think your approach is good Tom, keeping that commit for the trunk, and also backporting it to stable/ essex ; since I don't think changes are to be expect to Folsom."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-06-19 01:53:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Anybody know the status of nova-manage in folsom? I know it's intended to be deprecated eventually, but I don't know if the nova api has caught up in functionality yet."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-06-26 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-18 03:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

resurrecting'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-18 03:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-08-18 15:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

So, I guess nova-manage lives on in Folsom?'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-19 01:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As far as I can tell, based on discussion in the mailing list :s'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-08-20 15:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

[{'created': '2012-06-03 00:40:32.000000000', 'message': 'Slight fleshing of nova-manage doc

As per the bug report, there was a concern that certain nova-manage
commands such as those to do with image manipulation were not
properly represented in the documentation.

As nova-manage is slated to be removed in Folsom, simply extending
the phrasing a little and encouraging users to read the man page.

Feedback very welcome!

fixes bug 766703

Change-Id: Id94fe752a86c0e6c6ebeb2ed88a2f7526716f854

This is perhaps a stop-gap change until the proper CLI doc is in
place. As most commandline use is moving towards nova client, rather
than nova-manage simply extending
the phrasing a little and encouraging users to read the man page.

Placing nova client first, based on feedback

fixes bug 766703

Second patch - addresses concerns from previous patches about leading

administrators.

Change-Id: Id94fe752a86c0e6c6ebeb2ed88a2f7526716f854
'}]
commit_message:
Slight fleshing of nova-manage doc

This is perhaps a stop-gap change until the proper CLI doc is in
place. As most commandline use is moving towards nova client, rather
than nova-manage simply extending
the phrasing a little and encouraging users to read the man page.

Placing nova client first, based on feedback

fixes bug 766703

Second patch - addresses concerns from previous patches about leading
with novaclient, and emphasising that nova-manage is only for
administrators.

Change-Id: Id94fe752a86c0e6c6ebeb2ed88a2f7526716f854

commit_message:
Fixing unit test failures in Cisco plugin

Bug #1038565

The tests for bulk resource creation failure were failing since the bulk
API calls were not getting relayed correctly to the virt_phy_sw.py, that
has been fixed
There tests for the network_multi_blade_v2.py were failing since DB
initialization order was incorrect.
The tests in test_api_v2.py were failing since the plugin instance was
not being reset for each test.

Change-Id: I449bd8a61c1f61f98a97acf489574624fe309caa

[{'created': '2012-08-20 14:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add basic periodic task infrastructure.

So the idea is Manager will inherit from PeriodTasks
and create a timer to call run_periodic_tasks().

Part of blueprint service-infrastructure

commit_message:
Add basic periodic task infrastructure.

So the idea is Manager will inherit from PeriodTasks
and create a timer to call run_periodic_tasks().

Part of blueprint service-infrastructure

Signed-off-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I822b8501ad184d0e5885cada1a3d7a847e2ca12c

Make glance-jeos-add-from-github.sh scrape available images
so we avoid hard-coded image names, avoid adding duplicate
images if they already exist in glance.

'}]
commit_message:
heat tools : Updates to glance-jeos-add-from-github.sh

Make glance-jeos-add-from-github.sh scrape available images
so we avoid hard-coded image names, avoid adding duplicate
images if they already exist in glance.

Change-Id: I45330fb35211965ab4683048c9437163d18e5326
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix netns delete so that it works when a ns is set

bug 1038759

This fixes the bug by ensuring that the netns deletion always runs in the root
namespace.  Tests were updated to reflect the change in execute
invocation.

Change-Id: I008e8ecbc4bae86129af7f4a7b5d33c6ae423e5c

subject: Move manager.py and service.py into common.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/335/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/203/testReport : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/338/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/206/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/206/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/206/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for taking this on Angus!

Doug - I think it would be good to clean up as much as possible as it goes into common, but only if it doesn't prevent Nova adopting the common version quickly

i.e. if we "perfect" these while moving them into common and Nova doesn't move to the perfect version, we haven't achieved much

Definitely would like to see your detailed comments on how this could be improved

My gut instinct from just a glance is that there's too much here for a first patch - we could strip out some stuff for the first patch, improve the basic infrastructure and then pull in more stuff. I think that's what Angus is trying to do, I'm just saying we could go a bit further'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Where is the right place to talk about "fixing" some of these APIs? For example, the Service should take an instantiated manager, instead of the string name of a class. That would let the manager constructor take arguments, such as the database handle or some other resource that could be usefully mocked out in tests.

Do we want to fix things as they go into common, or just bring in what we have elsewhere and then change it later?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Angus and I had an email discussion about it, and the scope of the changes I would like to see are probably bigger than what we want to do in a first version.

The short version is: Service should not be instantiating Manager. Service should take a Manager instance as an argument, instead of the string name for importutils and the *args and **kwds.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/364/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/232/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/232/testReport : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/232/testReport : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/365/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/233/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/233/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/233/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

Ok, some initial comments inline

The big thing for me is that I'd like to see the patch split up into a series. It'll help at least me hugely to review it. I went ahead and took a stab at splitting it up:

https://github.com/markmc/openstack-common/commits/server-infrastructure

But the commit messages need work and the test case hasn't been split up either."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

On the multiprocess stuff, I'd be wary of asking Angus to significantly rework that before adding to common. It's quite a gnarly area and went through a lot of review in Nova 

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/multi-process-api-service

I mostly want to think about the API design and whether it leaves us flexibility for expansion later. If we get the API for multiprocess right, we can move this stuff out of incubation quickly and still change the implementation later."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So I have gone part way to Doug's request.

The constructor requires a Manager instance
but I have kept Service.create() to do the
import and creation of the Manager for normal
nova usage.

Mark: I am not sure how to create a more minimal manager/service without becoming featureless.
It seems quite slim atm, and still can actually be
useful."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (8 inline comments)

Thank you for your comments! Good ideas.

I'll look into:
1) separating the rpc code out into rpc/{manager,service}.py
2) investigate an external process launcher
3) separate the greenthead management out into loopingcall (or similar).

-Angus"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-20 08:47:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

commit_message:
Remove unused function in console api

Remove _translate_id_if_necessary from nova.console.api since its
now using instance_uuid and this function is not used anymore.
Complete fix for bug 1014796.

Change-Id: I1350497541ca6571b38a05d66ca3c5498d63a9b5

Overall I like the direction.

One minor nit:
* Wrong year (2011)

Questions/Comments:
* Leaving the extra_specs_ops in nova/scheduler/filters/ is misleading since it isn't a filter itself.
* Is it possible to make extra_specs_ops.py specific unit tests."}, {'account_id': 1176, 'date': '2012-08-16 15:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I guess leaving the extra_specs_ops in nova/scheduler/filters/ is ok since it is a part of filter. It does not say "filter" in its file name, so it won't be confusing. Another way is putting it in a subdirectory? Any other suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-16 15:27:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joseph - yes, I thought a little about this too. But, it won't be seen as a filter by the scheduler, so I think it's fine to have it in that directory. It's only used by modules in that directory, so it makes sense."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-08-16 15:30:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Joe:

> Is it possible to make extra_specs_ops.py specific unit tests.

Yes, I it is and I suggested this to Joseph in Iee9bf68011738aab146e6311a17cb3c673d7a392

I decided not to do this myself since Joseph mentioned he was writing unit tests for aggregate_instance_extra_specs'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-16 17:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Refactor extra specs matching into a new module

We want AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter to have the same extra specs
matching semantics as ComputeCapabilitiesFilter, so split the code out
so that it can be reused.

Change-Id: I6938c70f7272956eb27a6609546c3e20ec0dd99e

commit_message:
Disable I18N in Nova's test suites

Messages translated into other language like Chinese cause some
unit tests to fail.

Fixes LP bug #1037946.

Change-Id: I01d04333d28bab52d6f424432524b206f3845fba

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-15 00:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Restore libvirt block storage connections on reboot.

Fixes bug 1036902.

There are a number of cases where block storage connections are not properly
restored, impacting libvirt in particular. The most common case is a VM
which has block storage attached via iSCSI, whereby the physical system is
rebooted. When the system comes back up and starts nova-compute, the iSCSI
connections are NOT recreated for the instances slated to be resumed
(assuming resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set).

The patch changes the compute manager to pass block_storage_info via
driver.reboot() and driver.resume_state_on_host_boot(). The fix is
actually only present in the libvirt driver. However, all the other
drivers were updated to accept the additional, optional function args.

With the changes in place, iSCSI connections for libvirt are re-established
after a hypervisor reboot with resume_guests_state_on_host_boot=True and on
every hard_reboot. The latter is intended as so that users have a last ditch
option for recovering their VMs without administrative involvement.

Change-Id: Idf5d53f21991a359bec6ce26ae9fe3bd61800ce3
'}, {'created': '2012-08-15 00:05:13.000000000', 'message': 'Restore libvirt block storage connections on reboot.

commit_message:
Restore libvirt block storage connections on reboot.

Fixes bug 1036902.

There are a number of cases where block storage connections are not
properly restored, impacting libvirt in particular. The most common
case is a VM which has block storage attached via iSCSI, whereby the
physical system is rebooted. When the system comes back up and
starts nova-compute, the iSCSI connections are NOT recreated for the
instances slated to be resumed (assuming
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot is set).

The patch changes the compute manager to pass block_storage_info via
driver.reboot() and driver.resume_state_on_host_boot(). The fix is
actually only present in the libvirt driver. However, all the other
drivers were updated to accept the additional, optional function
arg.

With the changes in place, iSCSI connections for libvirt are
re-established after a hypervisor reboot with
resume_guests_state_on_host_boot=True and on every hard_reboot.
The latter is intended so that users have a last ditch option for
recovering their VMs without administrative involvement.

Change-Id: Idf5d53f21991a359bec6ce26ae9fe3bd61800ce3

commit_message:
Remove hard-coded 'admin' role checking and use policy instead

bug 1037786

This change removed hard-coded 'admin' role checking, and use policy check to
decide is_admin at the time of context construction. And also set
default admin role to 'admin', in policy template, to keep backward
compatibility.

Change-Id: I56b45bfdfba1b8e1391bde7fec3d4cf26c66324c

commit_message:
Fix bug 1038258
Removes flat_network_dhcp_start confi option and indicates
how to assign the first IP address from the DHCP server
with a nova-manage fixed reserve --address command.

Change-Id: I1d0e0410425e6aed58660c61a17e57545a5fdb89

[{'created': '2012-08-19 02:11:42.000000000', 'message': "Add multi_host=T example to network create for HA

fixes bug 1026155

As noted in the bug report, if you fail to specify multi_host=T on
the commandline when creating your fixed network, and you are using
the multi host HA option, it doesn't work so well.

This change provides an example to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I8086ae5264ee52069e8c9937e6f17ca9910ff7a7
"}]
commit_message:
Add multi_host=T example to network create for HA

fixes bug 1026155

As noted in the bug report, if you fail to specify multi_host=T on
the commandline when creating your fixed network, and you are using
the multi host HA option, it doesn't work so well.

This change provides an example to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I8086ae5264ee52069e8c9937e6f17ca9910ff7a7

Yong, Maru, and Gary:

Thanks for all your comments. They will be addressed as soon as possible.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Hi Nachi,

I went back to patchset1 to look at your comment.
I believe that a use case where L2 and L3 services are managed by different plugins is plausible and possible, as well as uses cases where a single plugin handles L2 + L3 (and the implementation you see here is an example of this).

However, our core architecture framework currently allows us to specify and load a single plugin. As L3 functionalities are now available as an extensions it was probably the right choice to not go and modify the core components which load the plugin for allowing a "core_L2_plugin" and a "core_L3_plugin".
Also, another architectural decision we need to take when dealing with multiple plugins is how to establish whether a given L3 plugin is compatible with the underlying L2 plugin.

It is my opinion that the current implementation does not "close the door" to a solution where you can load different plugins for different network services; however it would be better to discuss and plan carefully such a change rather than rushing it a few weeks before release.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-merge/1330/consoleFull : SUCCESS

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python26/967/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-quantum-python27/968/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

The latest patch solves the issue found by Gary, and adds a unit tests for verifying it.

Comment from Maru and Yong are already addressed.

On the atomic behavior, it has to be noted that in general we cannot guarantee it for calls that span the L3 and the L2 realms just by using subtransactions, as the services might be provided by different plugins.

Hovewer for plugin inheriting from db_base_plugin and the l3_mixin there will be single transaction spanning the whole operation.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

ok, I think there was a race that i created patch set 7 after seeing yong's and aaron's comments on patch set 6, but I hadn't yet seen maru's. Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi,
The code is up and running and works! I have found one issues that I think can be dealt with as a bug fix (up to you). I have a number of commands that I invoke (from arosen). 
When the command 
# create floating IP for VM2, associating it in same step
FIP2_ID=`quantum floatingip-create $PUB_NET_ID --port_id $VM2_PORT_ID | grep ' id' | awk '{ print $4 }'`
I executed there is an exception on the service. The trace is below. Please not that if the command is split in two:
FIP2_ID=`quantum floatingip-create $PUB_NET_ID | grep ' id' | awk '{ print $4 }'` and then quantum floatingip-associate $FIP1_ID $VM2_PORT_ID then it works (hence the +2).
The trace is below:
2012-08-19 10:06:58    DEBUG [quantum.db.db_base_plugin_v2] Generated mac for network e8f505c8-f1eb-4cec-9b8f-5b085417a058 is fa:16:3e:47:00:9b

  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 313, in commit
    self._prepare_impl()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/sqlalchemy/orm/session.py", line 297, in _prepare_impl
    self.session.flush()

@dan, I only took a brief look, so forgive me if made the wrong comments.

To me, I'd rather model a router with a collection of interfaces, and each interface can plug in a port on a network. Each router interface can have one or more IPs (and maybe able to map to real VLAN interfaces statically, or dynamically into tenant-networks.)

An open question is whether we should allow a router to be built to connect two networks belonging to two tenants, which might be an interesting use-case. Some access control issue there..."}, {'account_id': 2531, 'date': '2012-08-19 14:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixes some table footer bugs.

Fixes footer count being wrong for tables in tabs, and
fixes duplicate footer messages for tables with pagination.

Fixes bug 1038559.

Change-Id: I33a60530690bf22ad969b758d13af1a3ea07f729

commit_message:
Fix bug 1038258
Fix dupe bug 1038258
Removes flat_network_dhcp_start option from all nova.conf examples.

Adds the nova-manage fixed reserve --address=x.x.x.x command
as a way to accomplish the same thing.

Change-Id: Id1d292e9c80b1011f55cd4c4050600323a1d3deb

commit_message:
Add date range parameters to resource API

Allow the caller to query for resources updated within a certain
time range. Changes the storage engine API as well as the web
API.

Also includes a fix for the event date range query, which was
broken when both start and end values were used.

Change-Id: Ic482ea647ad07553a6621ba84ed76cf10d534652
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Document vhost_net as a workaround for connectivitiy.

Some operators have reported success with loading the vhost_net
kernel module as a workaround when faced with occasional network
connectivity failures. This patch documents this.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/11522

Change-Id: I1c0148591082695548b13923b28d60485df9098a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-18 02:09:06.000000000', 'message': 'Specify actual keystone IP address in api-paste.ini.

The example api-paste.ini used 127.0.0.1 as the IP address for
keystone. This proposed patch uses the actual IP address of the
machine (192.168.206.130). This file will now still work if
the nova-api service runs on a different machine than keystone.

https://review.openstack.org/11520

Change-Id: Icff1c9e6e96875339aefe35d5a4006b9b482cc7d
'}]
commit_message:
Specify actual keystone IP address in api-paste.ini.

The example api-paste.ini used 127.0.0.1 as the IP address for
keystone. This proposed patch uses the actual IP address of the
machine (192.168.206.130). This file will now still work if
the nova-api service runs on a different machine than keystone.

https://review.openstack.org/11520

Change-Id: Icff1c9e6e96875339aefe35d5a4006b9b482cc7d

As for the place, maybe it could be somewhere else, I found that was the best spot right there'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-08-17 00:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Upgraded anyjson to 0.3.3 - now kombu tests run.

With anyjson 0.2.4, kombu tests didn't run because of an
incompatibility between kombu and this version of anyjson.
With anyjson 0.3.3 one test failed, but it can be skipped
(similarly to another test about the same thing which already
is skipped).

Change-Id: Icd2ed0ae56964e6ec91b32b81e0f5b65163e40e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-10 06:01:36.000000000', 'message': 'handle exception correctly in _make_app_iter_reader

_make_app_iter_reader uses a queue to pass read data to
_make_app_iter, and uses an empty string as a terminator.  The problem
is that it pushes the same terminator even if it fails to reads the
data.  If an exception happens before pushing all data to the queue,
_make_app_iter exits without yielding all data.  In that case,
proxy-server stops in the middle of sending data, and a client waits
for all data to come infinitely.

This patch uses a boolean value for the terminator instead of an empty
string to distinguish the results, and raises an exception in the
error cases.  Fixes bug 890888.

Change-Id: Ie4d48025843aa1bb600446da6f4fc49f82a440bf
'}, {'created': '2012-08-10 06:08:24.000000000', 'message': 'handle exception correctly in _make_app_iter_reader

_make_app_iter_reader uses a queue to pass read data to
_make_app_iter, and uses an empty string as a terminator.  The problem
is that it pushes the same terminator even if it fails to reads the
data.  If an exception happens before pushing all data to the queue,
_make_app_iter exits without yielding all data.  In that case,
proxy-server stops in the middle of sending data, and a client waits
for all data to come infinitely.

This patch uses a boolean value for the terminator instead of an empty
string to distinguish the results, and raises an exception in the
error cases.  Fixes bug 890888.

Change-Id: Ie4d48025843aa1bb600446da6f4fc49f82a440bf
'}]
commit_message:
handle exception correctly in _make_app_iter_reader

_make_app_iter_reader uses a queue to pass read data to
_make_app_iter, and uses an empty string as a terminator.  The problem
is that it pushes the same terminator even if it fails to reads the
data.  If an exception happens before pushing all data to the queue,
_make_app_iter exits without yielding all data.  In that case,
proxy-server stops in the middle of sending data, and a client waits
for all data to come infinitely.

This patch uses a boolean value for the terminator instead of an empty
string to distinguish the results, and raises an exception in the
error cases.  Fixes bug 890888.

Change-Id: Ie4d48025843aa1bb600446da6f4fc49f82a440bf

[{'created': '2012-08-17 04:40:35.000000000', 'message': 'Shuffle download order (of containers and objects)

When downloading the same containers or objects with multiple
invocations of the swift command-line client, you'll get better
throughput and avoid "hot spots" if each client randomizes its download
order.

Note that the marker must be picked *before* shuffling the containers or
objects.

Change-Id: I7240eda57a80e1708c2483827c6329fd57d5fc51
'}]
commit_message:
Shuffle download order (of containers and objects)

When downloading the same containers or objects with multiple
invocations of the swift command-line client, you'll get better
throughput and avoid "hot spots" if each client randomizes its download
order.

Note that the marker must be picked *before* shuffling the containers or
objects.

Change-Id: I7240eda57a80e1708c2483827c6329fd57d5fc51

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 04:35:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add timing stats to verbose download output.

When using the swift command-line tool to evaluate a Swift cluster, it
can be very handy to get some insight into the download timing.  This
patch adds timing data to verbose output for the download command.  For
each downloaded file, the printed line will also contain:
 - The time it took to send the request and receive the header
 - The total time the request took (including writing the file out
   locally)
 - The average throughput of the download

Change-Id: Ib4a995623af973bb1eed4fb52c8c0e5da935964d
'}]
commit_message:
Add timing stats to verbose download output.

When using the swift command-line tool to evaluate a Swift cluster, it
can be very handy to get some insight into the download timing.  This
patch adds timing data to verbose output for the download command.  For
each downloaded file, the printed line will also contain:
 - The time it took to send the request and receive the header
 - The total time the request took (including writing the file out
   locally)
 - The average throughput of the download

Change-Id: Ib4a995623af973bb1eed4fb52c8c0e5da935964d

commit_message:
Inject command into userdata

The injected command touches /var/lib/cloud/instance/provision-finished
so it is easily determinable if provision has been completed.

Change-Id: Ib5b93f7bd14f533af41182ffdab6a029a3b9e13a
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-08-14 15:14:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove deprecated boot=on kvm flag.

Stop passing boot=on when invoking kvm manually, as this parameter
has been deprecated and is ignored.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/11211

Also, the arguments for manually booting a windows image with KVM were
different in the master and stable/essex branches. I backported all of the
command-line arguments since I assumed the master doc branch was more
up to date on this, but would help if somebody with more KVM knowledge
could sanity-check that.

Change-Id: Ifd7c4607f8101868ab99ac5c80b0c040983fc18b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove deprecated boot=on kvm flag.

Stop passing boot=on when invoking kvm manually, as this parameter
has been deprecated and is ignored.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/11211

Also, the arguments for manually booting a windows image with KVM were
different in the master and stable/essex branches. I backported all of the
command-line arguments since I assumed the master doc branch was more
up to date on this, but would help if somebody with more KVM knowledge
could sanity-check that.

Change-Id: Ifd7c4607f8101868ab99ac5c80b0c040983fc18b

commit_message:
Fix get_vnc_console race.

There exists a window between a server create is done and when the host
is assigned by the scheduler that a request to get the vnc console will
result in a 500 error.

This patch adds a check in the compute API to ensure that the instance
has a host assigned before try to execute a rpc on the compute node.
If not, it raises InstanceNotReady (which translates to a 409 in the
OS API).

Fix bug 1037809.

Change-Id: I3f5af90d57ae84f98f787e14ccb66f1841ac0c6d

commit_message:
Revert to prior method of executing a libvirt hard_reboot.

Fixes bug 1036826.

Using reset for hard_reboot is not reliable, even where it is supported
by libvirt. Hard reboots are one of the only ways to recover a VM in a
broken state. The reset command assumes the domain is running in some
capacity and will fail if it is not.

Hard reset is the current sledgehammer for fixing issues and it really
needs to stay that way.

Change-Id: I84705b72d79cf71adad066b18267fdfb199bc9cb

commit_message:
Fix a TypeError that occurs in _reschedule.

Updates the compute manager so that it passes the correct
arguments to the scheduler API's run_instance function.

Fixes the following exception which will occur if an instance
is rescheduled:

  TypeError: run_instance() got an unexpected keyword argument
  'reservations'

As part the fix the FakeSchedulerAPI we use in test_compute.py
has been updated to match the arguments of the real scheduler API.

Fixes LP Bug #1038193.

Change-Id: I25782b79a7b19013b25cb94cc5569b5aa83a2df0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-16 19:46:13.000000000', 'message': "multi_tenant: Fix 'context' is not defined error

Corrects the variable name 'context' to be 'self.context' in the
configure_add method of the swift store. We changed/moved this code
late during the review process of the multi_tenant swift feature
and obviously didn't add a functional/unit test on the new location
which now causes this exception to get thrown:

    NameError: global name 'context' is not defined

This patch also includes a new glance function test to startup
the Glance API in multi-tenant mode. The test_multi_tenant_mode
test will fail with the previous swift store implementation.

Fixes LP Bug #1037745

Change-Id: I7681ad704b169c5fe815adf2fe704e5d18ea8e83
"}]
commit_message:
multi_tenant: Fix 'context' is not defined error

Corrects the variable name 'context' to be 'self.context' in the
configure_add method of the swift store. We changed/moved this code
late during the review process of the multi_tenant swift feature
and obviously didn't add a functional/unit test on the new location
which now causes this exception to get thrown:

    NameError: global name 'context' is not defined

This patch also includes a new glance function test to startup
the Glance API in multi-tenant mode. The test_multi_tenant_mode
test will fail with the previous swift store implementation.

Fixes LP Bug #1037745

Change-Id: I7681ad704b169c5fe815adf2fe704e5d18ea8e83

commit_message:
Remove logging in volume tests

Fixes bug #932137

Usage of logging seems to be limited to the check_for_export() tests and
should be to cleanup. check_for_export() raises an exception if there's
a problem and it does nothing if it succeeds. The tests should just
check whether an exception was raised.

Change-Id: I411948031baeb7e36e6b15b9f31446a100da77d7

commit_message:
Fix use of non-existant var pool.

This code was using pool, but this variable did not exist.  It was
erroneously removed in f50ce35c9cf2e05d205485586da1cb6d5433ba56.
This patch fixes the bug, as well as introduces unit tests for this API
that would have caught the problem.

Part of bug 1037183.

Change-Id: I0784aa314a0224198049dbcbe160084bdd1deee1

commit_message:
Makes sure tests don't leave lockfiles around

Our new lockfile code works fine if the locks already exist, but
it is annoying to pollute the source tree with lockfiles in the
tests.

This modifies the lockfile code slightly to use a tempdir if
lock_path is none. Note that a tempdir will not work in production
but it is fine for testing. We set the lock_path to None in the
testing flags.

Also removes the explicit cleanup in run_tests.sh. The new solution
works with tox and will work even if we add new locks.

Fixes bug 1035426

Change-Id: I613926e4288442e79df50ea5f5bd8f9eafdfe7e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-16 05:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'Merge parts of ComputeFilter with ArchFilter

Commit d39137fa added the functionality to the ComputeFilter to filter
on architecture, hypervisor_type, and vm_mode.  The existing ArchFilter
already filtered on architecture.  This patch merges the ComputeFilter
functionality introduced in d39137fa with the ArchFilter.  An alternative
would have been to remove the ArchFilter, but there is a desire to keep
the compute filters simple and only have ComputeFilter filter on whether
the compute node is enabled.

This patch also adds the ArchFilter to the list of default filters
specified by the scheduler_default_filters FLAG.

Fixes LP Bug #1037339

DocImpact

Change-Id: I33f03b3c3721b6cfefcf8dd35c21b7b6bb4badfb
'}]
commit_message:
Merge parts of ComputeFilter with ArchFilter

Commit d39137fa added the functionality to the ComputeFilter to filter
on architecture, hypervisor_type, and vm_mode.  The existing ArchFilter
already filtered on architecture.  This patch merges the ComputeFilter
functionality introduced in d39137fa with the ArchFilter.  An alternative
would have been to remove the ArchFilter, but there is a desire to keep
the compute filters simple and only have ComputeFilter filter on whether
the compute node is enabled.

This patch also adds the ArchFilter to the list of default filters
specified by the scheduler_default_filters FLAG.

Fixes LP Bug #1037339

DocImpact

Change-Id: I33f03b3c3721b6cfefcf8dd35c21b7b6bb4badfb

commit_message:
Call driver for attach/detach_volume.

The volume driver may want to know which guest is going to be
attached to a volume. The manager now calls down into the driver
on attach_volume and detach_volume.

Fixes bug 1038109.

Change-Id: I084c2d09a1871fa158312f9ba479abb474da1d28

Looks good to me.

One thing to watch out for when removing unused imports is configuration options

e.g. module A may have this:

  opt = StrOpt('foo')
  FLAGS.register_opt(opt)

module B might do this:

  import A

  ...

     if FLAGS.foo:
        ....

i.e. module B really does use module A

If you come across a situation like this, you should change it to:

  FLAGS.DECLARE('foo', 'A')

  ...

     if FLAGS.foo:
        ....

this still imports module A, but makes it clear that it is used"}, {'account_id': 2481, 'date': '2012-08-17 13:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 15:13:41.000000000', 'message': "Don't trap then re-raise ImportError.

When we catch ImportError, print a message, and then raise a new ImportError,
we lose sane ability to read the traceback, and we gain nothing. Raising a new
ImportError on Attribute or Value error is helpful, given the context in which
we are working.

Change-Id: I52f61405e63535bcc745c9d350aa0dfbae36a8ac
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trap then re-raise ImportError.

When we catch ImportError, print a message, and then raise a new ImportError,
we lose sane ability to read the traceback, and we gain nothing. Raising a new
ImportError on Attribute or Value error is helpful, given the context in which
we are working.

Change-Id: I52f61405e63535bcc745c9d350aa0dfbae36a8ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-16 17:15:15.000000000', 'message': 'PKI Token revocation

Co-authored-by: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Token revocations are captured in the backends,

During upgrade, all previous tickets are defaulted to valid.

Revocation list returned as a signed document and can be fetched in an admin context via HTTP

Change config values for enable diable PKI

In the auth_token middleware,  the revocation list is fetched prior
to validating tokens. Any tokens that are on the revocation list
will be treated as invalid.

Added in PKI token tests that check the same logic as the UUID tests.
Sample data for the tests is read out of the signing directory.

Also fixes 1031373

Bug 1037683

Change-Id: Icef2f173e50fe3cce4273c161f69d41259bf5d23

commit_message:
PKI Token revocation

Co-authored-by: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>

Token revocations are captured in the backends,

During upgrade, all previous tickets are defaulted to valid.

Revocation list returned as a signed document and can be fetched in an admin context via HTTP

Change config values for enable diable PKI

In the auth_token middleware,  the revocation list is fetched prior
to validating tokens. Any tokens that are on the revocation list
will be treated as invalid.

Added in PKI token tests that check the same logic as the UUID tests.
Sample data for the tests is read out of the signing directory.

dropped number on sql scripts to pass tests.

Also fixes 1031373

Bug 1037683

Change-Id: Icef2f173e50fe3cce4273c161f69d41259bf5d23

commit_message:
Validate uuid-ness in v2 image entity

The image entity was allowing any string value to pass through in
an image create operation. We should limit it strictly to UUID-like
values.

Fixes bug 1037725

Change-Id: I3f28d3f2dc5c0f63322efe250051874d7975ec1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 05:22:16.000000000', 'message': 'Revert per-user-quotas

See bug 1034384, bug 1037590.

This reverts commit https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/391f345d,
but leaves the DB migration in place while adding a further
migration to reverse it.

The motivation for reversion is that the per-user quota logic would
totally undermine the per-project quotas set for a pre-existing
openstack install.

The per-user quota logic could be re-introduced in a fixed state
after Folsom-3.

Change-Id: Idd4b55a2404a25f43f6737b661f828c28501066f
(cherry picked from commit bf7862222d25c9bd09671b90fed3287cbe26e488)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert per-user-quotas

See bug 1034384, bug 1037590.

This reverts commit https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/391f345d,
but leaves the DB migration in place while adding a further
migration to reverse it.

The motivation for reversion is that the per-user quota logic would
totally undermine the per-project quotas set for a pre-existing
openstack install.

The per-user quota logic could be re-introduced in a fixed state
after Folsom-3.

Change-Id: Idd4b55a2404a25f43f6737b661f828c28501066f
(cherry picked from commit bf7862222d25c9bd09671b90fed3287cbe26e488)

commit_message:
Fix regression in compute_capabilities filter

Fixes bug #1037503

Restore the previous behaviour of matching simple strings in extra
specs against compute node capabilities.

Change-Id: I485e9e63f860a83f7c9c0c41d09919eabe9e66ae
(cherry picked from commit 4ec703243415b9eb6d57bd72f2f6704a95308067)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 06:08:23.000000000', 'message': 'Implement GET (show) in OS API keypairs extension.

Includes test for showing a keypair (existing and non-existing).

This commit also corrects the name of the KeyPairNotFound exception
in the test_keypair_delete_not_found test case.

Additionally some extra print statements in the tests were
removed.

DocImpact - need to add documentation for GET on: v2/{tenant_id}/os-keypairs/{keypair_name}

Fixes LP Bug #925731.

commit_message:
Implement GET (show) in OS API keypairs extension.

Includes test for showing a keypair (existing and non-existing).

This commit also corrects the name of the KeyPairNotFound exception
in the test_keypair_delete_not_found test case.

Additionally some extra print statements in the tests were
removed.

DocImpact - need to add documentation for GET on: v2/{tenant_id}/os-keypairs/{keypair_name}

Fixes LP Bug #925731.

Change-Id: I9eeb47ccb9bf352c554aa44aa562c47e3eb33cae
(cherry picked from commit 06d1f0dfd5d22ace96b414fd0b71fbaa668b95ce)

commit_message:
Revert per-user-quotas

See bug 1034384, bug 1037590.

This reverts commit https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/391f345d,
but leaves the DB migration in place while adding a further
migration to reverse it.

The motivation for reversion is that the per-user quota logic would
totally undermine the per-project quotas set for a pre-existing
openstack install.

The per-user quota logic could be re-introduced in a fixed state
after Folsom-3.

Change-Id: Idd4b55a2404a25f43f6737b661f828c28501066f

commit_message:
Fix regression in compute_capabilities filter

Fixes bug #1037503

Restore the previous behaviour of matching simple strings in extra
specs against compute node capabilities.

Change-Id: I485e9e63f860a83f7c9c0c41d09919eabe9e66ae

commit_message:
Refactor ComputeCapabilitiesFilter test cases

With so much duplicated code in the test cases, it's really very
difficult to figure out what each of the cases are testing. DRY
the tests up to make them much more clear.

Change-Id: Ie075d44165996fc4f744a49ddbdfd7c49a0c862e

commit_message:
Sync changes from openstack common

 * Changes to cfg to handle None overrides, tilde expansion,
   and importing opts.
 * Changes to timeutils to marshall and unmarshall datetimes.
 * Cleanups for zeromq and rpc.
 * Removal of unused imports.

Change-Id: Ica7a2e51ea38f37b315be2ff382d4a615dd67207

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-17 01:06:12.000000000', 'message': 'Specify actual keystone IP address in api-paste.ini.

The example api-paste.ini used 127.0.0.1 as the IP address for
keystone. This proposed patch uses the actual IP address of the
machine (192.168.206.130). This file will now still work if
the nova-api service runs on a different machine than keystone.

Change-Id: Icff1c9e6e96875339aefe35d5a4006b9b482cc7d
'}]
commit_message:
Specify actual keystone IP address in api-paste.ini.

The example api-paste.ini used 127.0.0.1 as the IP address for
keystone. This proposed patch uses the actual IP address of the
machine (192.168.206.130). This file will now still work if
the nova-api service runs on a different machine than keystone.

Change-Id: Icff1c9e6e96875339aefe35d5a4006b9b482cc7d

Build successful

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I agree with the above comments.
Moreover, the field selection mechanism on the server-side has in the past produced some unexpected side effects (especially wrt policy evaluation), due to the fact that the plugin does not return attributes apart from the selected ones to the API layer.

So, I would prefer to limit visualization on the client side. I l know, it is inefficient, but I regard it as safer. 

One might argue that actually field selection should be done at the API and not at the plugin later, but this is another story.'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, when I proposed providing a limited list capability, I envisioned that it would be a client-side only thing.  I think pushing this to the server adds unneeded complexity there.  If the client cannot use fields to explicitly request just a subset of the columns, I'd probably just prefer a solution where the client fetches it all and throws some of the columns away."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi,
I have a number of concerns with this:
1. Why is the filtering not done in the client?
2. A new field can be added and the flag set which may cause the original print out problems. 
As far as I understand it the problem is that way in which the information is displayed on the client side and not what is returned.
Thank
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We have a view function and the attr_map to do the actual job on the server. Why do you think it is the client's responsiblity? In fact quantum client is so generic, it can know nothing about what is in the response body's json. It just passes a dict to prettytable module to show the data."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-08-17 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

we will do it on client side.'}]

'}]
commit_message:
*-list command shows only limited fields normally.

Bug #1036051

We add list-normal flag to attr map to control the field in list commands.
These flag is overriden if we use -D option in command.

Change-Id: I28c4c8f1573467674ff97687e4d7ad71d579ff29

commit_message:
Use a common constant for the port/network 'status' value

Fixes bug 1036054.

'status' have four values 'ACTIVE/DOWN/ERROR/BUILD' in v2 spec.
However, some plugins still using 'UP/DOWN' from v1. In order to
consistent the use of 'status' value. A common constant file was
created and modified all plugins to use the same constant value.

Change-Id: I865dffbe031d9a3e76e52e334db3050a3ef11ed0

commit_message:
Adding beaker cache.

* Provide a unified caching layer for openstack projects
* Useful for auth caching and metadata caching
* Pluggable with different backends (memcache, memory, db, etc..)

Change-Id: Id67ba90e8936f56502f914964469edea762692a3

Some operators have reported success with loading the vhost_net
kernel module as a workaround when faced with occasional network

'}]
commit_message:
Document vhost_net as a workaround for connectivitiy.

Some operators have reported success with loading the vhost_net
kernel module as a workaround when faced with occasional network
connectivity failurs. This patch documents this.

Change-Id: I1c0148591082695548b13923b28d60485df9098a

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python26/4291/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-python27/4343/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7594/consoleFull : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 1970, 'date': '2012-08-13 13:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Two tests failed in gate-tempest-devstack-vm. One is floating_ips, the other is euca.
In floating_ips test is done by executting "devstack/exercises/floating_ips.sh" which
includes the following steps:
  1. nova delete $VM_UUID
  2. if ! timeout $TERMINATE_TIMEOUT sh -c "while nova show $VM_UUID | grep status | grep -q ACTIVE; do sleep 1; done"; then
        echo "server didn't shut down!"
        exit 1
     fi
  3. nova secgroup-delete $SECGROUP
The 2nd step is used to make sure the instance has been deleted. Since we don't return
deleting instance to user any more. It finishes immediately. In the 3rd step
it trys to delete a security group which has one instance associated with it.
Even though the instance is being deleted, when the security group association is not
destroyed yet "nova secgroup-delete" fails.

So does "devstack/exercises/euca.sh".

Devstack should not rely on "nova show" or "euca-describe-instances $INSTANCE"
to make sure a instance has been deleted in the future. 
May sleep $TERMINATE_TIMEOUT in test enviroment after "nova delete" before
deleting a secgroup.'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-08-13 14:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jian, a quick tip for gerrit: make sure you use the same Change-Id ( usually git commit -a --amend will take care of it) so that your patches are in the same thread for review. thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1970, 'date': '2012-08-14 01:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yun. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-14 16:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

we need a fix for the security group deletion info. That is horrible user experience. It may mean we have to delayed delete security groups as well :("}, {'account_id': 1970, 'date': '2012-08-17 02:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Duplicated topic'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-13 07:48:44.000000000', 'message': 'Deletes instance in any state

As commit 129b87e17d3333aeaa9e855a70dea51e6581ea63 says now we
allow delete to be called no matter what vm_state says.

If an instance is in deleting state we should never return it to
the user or bill.
Checking for a task_state of "deleting" on compute manager
start_up and re-starting the delete.

Implements blueprint delete-in-any-state.

Change-Id: I228bdf55351eb04abfa1eaecc2880189b6a2c93b
'}]
commit_message:
Deletes instance in any state

As commit 129b87e17d3333aeaa9e855a70dea51e6581ea63 says now we
allow delete to be called no matter what vm_state says.

If an instance is in deleting state we should never return it to
the user or bill.
Checking for a task_state of "deleting" on compute manager
start_up and re-starting the delete.

Implements blueprint delete-in-any-state.

Change-Id: I228bdf55351eb04abfa1eaecc2880189b6a2c93b

commit_message:
Implement GET (show) in OS API keypairs extension.

Includes test for showing a keypair (existing and non-existing).

This commit also corrects the name of the KeyPairNotFound exception
in the test_keypair_delete_not_found test case.

Additionally some extra print statements in the tests were
removed.

DocImpact - need to add documentation for GET on: v2/{tenant_id}/os-keypairs/{keypair_name}

Fixes LP Bug #925731.

Change-Id: I9eeb47ccb9bf352c554aa44aa562c47e3eb33cae

commit_message:
xenapi: attach root disk during rescue before boot

Fixes bug 1037729

The xenapi driver attaches the root disk after the rescue instance has
booted. However, hotplugging block devices is only supported on images
that use PV drivers. Attaching the disk before the rescue instance boots
will allow rescue to work on instances that don't use PV drivers.

Change-Id: I187762e4f1ea921d81afd40fcbde0b93d7d3cbc1

'}, {'created': '2012-07-27 02:25:04.000000000', 'message': "use REDIRECT to forward local metadata request

VMs can not get metadata when metadata_host is set to 127.0.0.1 because

Change-Id: I162fc57510ef9c8e84130b2d11eb53e10dcc5cb0

commit_message:
use REDIRECT to forward local metadata request

VMs can not get metadata when metadata_host is set to 127.0.0.1 because
packet's destination address will be changed into 127.0.0.1 by iptables.
However, linux kernel will reject packets to 127.0.0.0/8 if packets do not
come from that range. We can use REDIRECT to resolve this problem because
REDIRECT will rewrite the destination address to our own host.

Fixes bug 1015853.

Change-Id: I162fc57510ef9c8e84130b2d11eb53e10dcc5cb0

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 02:11:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This has been on my list forever... so thanks! :)   First, as is, there's some cleanups in the scheduler can be made along with this patch...

However, I more -1 this because I really wanted to make it 1 rpc cast vs a lot of rpc casts.  It's a bit more efficient that way and will better allow us to deal with race conditions after this lands:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9402/

Basically, after that patch lands, many calls to the scheduler close together will result in a lot of race condition resolution in the compute managers and re-scheduling.  However, changing your patch to a single rpc cast allows the scheduler to temporarily reserve host resources as it schedules the 'x' instances.

This means more work to this patch, though (mostly scheduler side).  If this is more than you want to do right now and agree with it... I can probably help out and finish that part up in a bit.."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-08-15 11:52:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've done more work on this... but there's a little left, including fixing all of the tests if we want to go this route:

https://github.com/comstud/nova/tree/bug/1036911

If we want to go with the current patch for now instead of all of the extra changes....  I've found some additional issues.  quotas won't work correctly (i've addressed them in my branch).  Thought maybe there was 1 more thing.. but it's too late for me to think straight."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-16 06:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-08-16 06:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-16 06:58:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-15 01:02:13.000000000', 'message': 'Always create the instance db record locally

A request for multiple instances was sent to the scheduler, where
it was written to the database. It appears that this was one so
that more advanced schedulers could handle the request as one
batch, but the result is the scheduler is sometimes slow enough
that the call will timeout.

Instead this converts to always creating the instance locally
and sending each request in its own cast. This should allow
large numbers of instances to be created without timouts.

Fixes bug 1036911

Change-Id: I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
'}, {'created': '2012-08-16 06:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Always create the instance db record locally

A request for multiple instances was sent to the scheduler, where
it was written to the database. It appears that this was one so
that more advanced schedulers could handle the request as one
batch, but the result is the scheduler is sometimes slow enough
that the call will timeout.

Instead this converts to always creating the instance records
locally and always casting to the scheduler.

This made a small change to the rpc api for run instance, but
legacy messages are still handled properly.

Fixes bug 1036911

Co-authored-by: Chris Behrens <cbehrens@codestud.com>

Change-Id: I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68

commit_message:
Always create the run_instance records locally

Currently a request for multiple instances issent to the scheduler,
where it is written to the database. It appears that this was done so
that more advanced schedulers could handle the request as one
batch, but the result is the scheduler is sometimes slow enough
that the call will timeout.

Instead this converts to always creating the instance records
locally and making run_instance into a casting instead of a call.

This made a small change to the rpc api for run instance, so the
version was bumped. Legacy messages are still handled properly.

Fixes bug 1036911

Co-authored-by: Chris Behrens <cbehrens@codestud.com>

Change-Id: I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68

commit_message:
Fix build_sphinx setup.py command.

The DB migrate manage script needed to be wrapped in an if statement
so that the autodocumentation did not barf on it. Additionally add a
copyright header while we were editing the file.

Change-Id: I0a37036d304790b52dde7fb68d37a6c99204b596

I agree with Jason. Our goal is to move away from the legacy conversion. It was only put in place to make the new network model backwards compatible and as a shim so we could keep the commits smaller."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-08-13 16:09:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The blueprint details should *not* be in the 1st line of the GIT commit message. The first line should be a concise summary of the change. The blueprint name is best placed immediately before the Change-Id line. For further reference see

http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages#Information_in_commit_messages"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-08-14 01:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 01:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

(7 inline comments)

Hey Alessandro! I have some inline comments."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-08-14 16:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-14 16:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7774/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-08-15 14:13:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

New virt drivers should not rely on the legacy network_info format, they should be using the network_info model."}, {'account_id': 180, 'date': '2012-08-15 14:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Networking is limited in Hyper-V currently, I believe the plan is to fully integrate with Quantum on the 2012 RTM stuff once it comes out, possibly with OVS. Either way, legacy network_info usage shouldn't prevent inclusion in Folsom when weighing that against all of the well tested features this patch adds."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-08-15 15:32:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The actual patch is simple, and I believe Koelker is currently working on exactly how to accomplish this so he can show you. Networking as it's implemented in this driver is effectively a regression, as we've gone to great trouble to move to the newer modeling."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-08-15 15:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Jordan, 

"legacy network_info usage shouldn't prevent inclusion in Folsom"

why would using the correct network model prevent this from being merged in Folsom?'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-08-15 15:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'm not sure what Quantum has to do with using the network_info models, but since networking is limited in hyper-v it is a very small change:

diff --git a/nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py b/nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py
index 9951f35..e6549d8 100644
--- a/nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py
+++ b/nova/virt/hyperv/driver.py
@@ -236,3 +236,6 @@ class HyperVDriver(driver.ComputeDriver):
     def get_console_output(self, instance):
         LOG.debug("get_console_output called: %s", instance["name"])
         return ''
+
+    def legacy_nwinfo(self):
+        return False
diff --git a/nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py b/nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py
index b8b7663..a6e6036 100644
--- a/nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py
+++ b/nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py
@@ -159,10 +159,9 @@ class VMOps(baseops.BaseOps):
             #A SCSI controller for volumes connection is created
             self._create_scsi_controller(instance['name'])
 
-            for (network, mapping) in network_info:
-                mac_address = mapping['mac'].replace(':', '')
-
-            self._create_nic(instance['name'], mac_address)
+            for vif in network_info:
+                mac_address = vif['address'].replace(':', '')
+                self._create_nic(instance['name'], mac_address)
 
             LOG.debug(_('Starting VM %s '), instance_name)
             self._set_vm_state(instance['name'], 'Enabled')

The problem with allowing it in without using the new network_info, is then people will add features using the deprecated format. We want to remove that format since it is extremely limited and no new features are going to be added to it.

Also syntastic or flake8 should be run on this, there are a bunch of unused imports all over.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-08-15 20:12:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-15 20:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/7988/consoleFull : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-08-15 21:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

looking good. tests pass. some cleanups inline. There are probably some others but those can be bug fixes IMO. Other than that I'm cool with it. I know you guys are working with monty to get better jenkins integration."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-08-16 00:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (3 inline comments)

This code looks reasonable, although I had a few questions I've put into comments. Additionally, you have a lot of debug logging. I wonder if some of it should be promoted to info logging to help out ops people debugging problems?"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-08-16 00:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-16 00:35:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V support in nova-compute (with new network_info model), including unit tests

blueprint hyper-v-revival

Features included in ths commit:

Spawn (including CoW image option support)
Destroy
Info
List
Pause
Unpause
Suspend
Resume
Reboot
Power On
Power Off
Snapshot
Volume Attach
Volume Detach
Boot from Volume
Live Migration

Supported platforms:

Windows Server / Hyper-V Server 2008 R2
Windows Server / Hyper-V Server 2012

Unit tests:

Unit tests for all the listed features are included.
Tests can be execute on Linux as well.

nova.conf relevant flags:

Compute driver:

compute_driver=nova.virt.hyperv.driver.HyperVDriver

External vswitch to be used:

vswitch_name=an_external_vswitch

Path where the VHDs are going to be stored

instances_path=C:\Hyper-V\instances

Live migration support for hosts with etherogeneus CPUs

limit_cpu_features=true

Change-Id: Ic40adcd2d78b0ca6792d77940810f5a44de8cc37

commit_message:
Install XenServer tools from the iso on XenServer

Fixes bug 1032122 by ensuring, where possible, we use the tools
shipped with XenServer rather than downloading the tools from
images.ansolabs.com

Change-Id: I4592eca315b4700e73097d678309d00323923c8b

commit_message:
Use keystoneauth middleware from swift.

- We have moved swift to keystone middleware to swift use it.
- Should be referenced now as keystoneauth.
- Make swift-init silently pass in unstack even when swift was not yet
  installed.

Change-Id: Ibf9443608b7aa81be5f48f555e95ff5f4c8065bd
